I am completely single. I have no children, and have never been married. What I want more than anything is to change all of that! I would love to find a SWM in the age range of 28-40(ish), located LOCALLY (within 30-40 minutes) from me. I am seeking a LTR ONLY, possibly leading to marriage some day (No, I'm not interested in "hooking up" with you). 

I love a good sense of humor and witty intelligence above all else. Honesty, integrity and compassion are all equally important. Good personal hygiene is a must! (Sad that I have to explicitly state that). You don't have to go to church, but a belief in God is important. No alcohol or drug dependencies!
I come from a good country family. I was born and raised country and I love it! While I like doing things such as ATV riding, bonfires and muddin, I also enjoy things like going to a concert, comedy shows, Broadway shows etc. I don't really listen to country music (I'm more of a classic rock girl) but I'm not going to tease you if you do. My family are avid hunters and fishermen, so if you're one of those people who are in favor of taking everyone's guns- keep walking!

Physically, I a normally find myself attracted to dark hair and eyes, tall men, (well maintained) beards are good. I do like tattoos as long as they are below the neck. HOWEVER, I want to love your soul not your face! The only real request I have is someone who is average to a little extra weight built. Since I am trying so hard to change my lifestyle and eating habits I need someone who can support me with that and not drag me down with theirs. 

I know this is a lot to read so if you have made it through pat yourself on the back! Like I said in my title maybe I'm looking for the impossible, but you never know what you'll find unless you put yourself out there. If I sound interesting to you, message me! I will gladly exchange pic for pic after you send me one *smiles*. Please do NOT send me nude pictures or ask for any from me. To prove to me that you have actually taken the time to read this, type "I read it!" in the title of your response please. This is my second attempt here and 99% of the emails started with "So what are you looking for?" I really hope you're out there, and you're looking for me too.

title: 15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating
text:
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), but that doesn't mean you don't sometimes want to throw your hands up in the air and say, "forget it! I'd rather be single for life." The planning, the getting your hopes up about a new guy, the being disappointed, the feeling like there are no decent guys left in the world, we've all been there. They do say you'll find the One when you stop looking, so maybe it's time we just put that little piece of dating wisdom to the test.

1. Guys who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. What is he waiting for? Does he need a hand written invitation in order to hang out with you in person? Even worse when you take a chance and ask him out, and he still can't seem to commit to anything.

2. When you find out he already has a girlfriend. But we had such a connection, what do you mean he's not single? Why would he flirt with me like that then?!

3. When your friend meets her soul mate after being on OKCupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and she finds the Chris Pratt in the online dating rough without even having a photo up?!

4. When he invites you out and then "forgets" his wallet. Look, we have no problem paying for our half, but when it's clear he had no intention of paying at all, we have to consider sneaking out through the bathroom window, and leaving him to wash dishes to pay off his debt.

5. When his idea of a date is bringing his entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. A date shouldn't involve him making sure his wing man has a shot with one of your friends.

6. When you think it's going well and he freaks out because you left a spare tampon in his bathroom. Or worse, when he accuses you of leaving it there, but it was actually his roommate's girlfriend.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Somehow it seemed more productive to revive an old relationship than find someone new. You were wrong. Twice. Dating is just too much work.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. Even when it seems like the first date was fantastic, somehow planning the second date becomes harder than trying to schedule brunch with Beyonce.

9. The unsolicited dick pic. Once second you were innocently talking about the third season of House of Cards, and the next, there's a dick on your phone.

10. Watching your friend go through a bad breakup. If you start dating someone, there's a pretty good chance that crying mess on the couch eating an entire bag of Smart Food dipped in peanut butter will be you in the foreseeable future.

11. Coffee dates. Unless you're going on dates at 9am, caffeine is ill advised. No one wants to put any effort into first dates anymore, meaning you end up drinking way more lattes than you should be, and every date becomes pretty dull and repetitive.

12. When he looks nothing like his picture. The question is, do you call him on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap?

13. When he leaves you with the bill because you didn't want to hook up. This guy doesn't even pretend he forgot his wallet. He just doesn't come back from the bathroom. So that's why he chose the corner booth with no view of the door.

14. Finding out he's a racist, homophobic, pro-life, misogynistic actual crazy person. It's official, there are no nice, normal guys left. You can end the search now.

15. When staying home in your pjs is more appealing than going out. You could go on another date with this guy, or that guy, but why bother? At least your cat doesn't have uncontrollable gas or make you watch UFC. Once you realize the gloriousness of being single, there isn't much short of a millionaire who looks like David Beckham that will convince you to go on a date ever again. At least for now.

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, inwhich city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay.

title: The Dating Game
text:
Bachelor number one, "If your date told your best friend that she wanted to be picked up in style for an evening at the opera which of these forms of conveyance will you choose to arrive at her door?.
A. A Limousine
B. A horse and carriage
C. Your best friend's Lamborghini
D. Your own car, after you've sprung to have it detailed.

Bachelor number two, "Your date is a divorce attorney. What would you do to give her confidence that your first date may in fact, not be your last?
A. You would bring her a lavish, yet tasteful bouquet of flowers.
B. You would treat her to a massage at the finest spa in town the day before your date.
C. You would arrive to pick her up from her home ten minutes early with a surprise of tickets to a U2
concert in a city 5 hours away, with round trip plane tickets tucked into the envelope 
D. You would buy yourself a new suit, get your hair styled and have a manicure. You want her to know you take care of yourself and you'll be around for a long, long time.

Bachelor number three. "Your date is a well known politician. What kind of evening would you plan to provide her with a boost in the latest polls?"
A. You would make reservations at the finest French restaurant in your city, followed up by an evening at the opening of a new Broadway show. See and be seen is your motto.
B. You would treat her to an evening at the opening show of the newest up and coming visual artist at an exclusive gallery in mid town.
C. You would rent a Lamborghini and drive her to one of the most trendy clubs in town, and give her a chance to let her hair down and dance the night away.
D. You would catch a bite to eat at the Old Ebbitt Grill followed by a performance of Wagner's opera, Parsifal at the Kennedy Center. Politicos need to have stamina and that's whats called for if you and your date are to remain conscious during the entire performance.

title: Friends and Compatriots
text:
Hello everyone out there. I am newish to the area. I grew up here but haven't live here for awhile now. I didn't keep in touch with many people who still live in the valley and am not making friends at work because I work as a sub on assignment and I haven't been in any one class long enough to get to know anyone there. 
I do have a very short list of friends including my best friend who lives with me along with her 2 daughters. I don't have kids but since we live together I do have kids at home and that complicates some stuff. And afterall I'm looking for some outside of my house friends. 
Like I said I work as a substitute teacher and I aspire to making teaching a more permanent thing. Or maybe I will be a Mason. I have been enjoying the freedoms freelancing. I try to work everyday but there aren't always jobs and on those days I have plenty to distract myself with but like anyone I'd like to find someone to join me on some of these free days. 
I want to go visit Woodward Park. I've never been! It's snowy now and I don't have chains for my own car but maybe we can visit fish camp. 
My sister lives on Orange County and I drive out there often. This weekend that's where I will be celebrating my birthday! Maybe you like road trips. I love them. In the spring I'm going to Rock Fiesta in Arizona. It's a camp out and I'm not an experienced camper so, I'm nervous about maintaining a minimum amount of comfort. I would like to sleep well. 2 long days requires some good sleep. Do you like goin to rock shows? I do. It's one of my fave ways to blow my last few dollars. Sometimes it's worth living poor to end up seeing My Morning Jacket, Cafe Tacvba, Deftones, Tool or some other bands live. Let's go see a show together. 
Let's watch some tv. Winter is coming and Game of thrones comes back soon. Maybe the walking dead? 
I like going out for taco Tuesday and having some beers. The Tioga Springs beer garden is nice. I'd love to go back with someone. I've also been to Peeves Public house. They have good prices beer pints and an outdoor patio. Show me a place you like to have drinks. I'm a beer person myself but a mixed drink or some nice whiskey sometimes hits the spot. 
I guess what I'm looking for starts to sound like activity partner but it's not. I'd like to get to know you and become good friends. Maybe we click or hit it off or whatever. 
I into my 30's. I am single. Never been married. 3 exes in far distant lands. 
I like to travel and airfares are dropping right around now. Who wants to go visit Chicago because it's $150 airfare round trip? Let's go have deep dish pizza. Visit a museum or my college pub. 
I into science fiction. I enjoyed the new Star Wars very much. Can't wait for more. This summer's Star Trek is much anticipated. This is tre of probably everyone in the world but still with mentioning I think. I'd like to go see Star Wars again and I might go by myself but I'm putting the feelers out to maybe find someone to accompany me. It'll be fun. 
Having said a bunch of stuff and gone on and on I would like to now add that I am into 420. It my favorite way to relax and I like to go out that way. It's not an always thing but sometimes with other like minded people it can get to be. I still lead an active productive life. Clearly I'm not drug free and I know some of you aren't into that.
I'm ok with marijuana but not really much else. Drinking and toking. That's it.

title: Independent, Intelligent Woman Seeking a Great Catch!
text:
I'm a normal, educated, and independent young woman, looking for someone special for a fulfilling and exciting relationship. I've achieved many of the other essentials and balances of a satisfying life, but haven't yet found the right person to spend it with. I hold a college degree, a full time job, make a great living, and find plenty of things to occupy my time that bring joy, passion, and welcome challenges to my days. 

I'd describe myself as someone who is very happy on her own, but places great value on finding someone special to share are build my life with. I enjoy having partners with mutual interests, as well as those who have passions for things I may not have been exposed to, as I love learning new things, embarking on new adventures, and shifting a bit outside of my comfort zone; it keeps me on my toes! As far as things I'm interested in, you can find me outdoors as often as possible as the weather heats up, marking up my travel list, finding any excuse to be in or around the water, heading out on spur of the moment road trips and bike riding. I never need much of an excuse to head to the movies, sing along with my favorite artists when they tour in my direction, or just enjoying the quiet of an evening at home. 

I work hard to afford an independent life, and am not the type of woman who is interested in you for your wallet. I'm kind, compassionate, respectful, affectionate, and don't find any challenge in making the important people in my life know that they are loved and cared for. My friends and family are important to me, and I really value developing relationships with people who have connections, interests, and passions outside of me, as I believe nurturing all areas of our lives make us better for each other when we are together. 

I'm 5'8", brown eyes, a brunette, proportionate feminine curves, libidinous, and a confident demeanor, with pictures that demonstrate all of the aforementioned. I have no interest in casual relationships, and understand that solid foundations take time to develop. I'm drug free, disease free, and drink socially and responsibly. I'd like to think I'm a pretty thorough communicator, will tell you what's on my mind instead of expecting you to read it, and am content far more often than not, as I think there is too much good and joy to be experienced to waste much time on negativity and drama. 

I think I'm a great catch, and I'd ideally like to meet a man who thinks the same of himself! Being humble is important, but I think we also have to know our self-worth. If you've found yourself in a similar boat, holding out for that person that makes your heart beat a little faster, brightens your smile, and highlights your day, then I believe we may just be looking for each other. 

If you're interested, please send a unique message and enjoy your day!

title: Want more out of life?
text:
Would you like to meet a woman who is feminine, but not helpless; can be affectionate and playful; does not make unreasonable demands; is not depressed and gloomy; is not a wildly emotional actress; does not drain your energy; leaves you alone when you need solitude; can talk and be silent at the right times; is at ease with you; recovers fast after a crisis; has practical activities and knows that naturalness is beauty?

Are you a man who is inwardly strong and responsible; has a sense of humor; does not pounce on faults; does not think cruelty is strength; is practical in financial matters; is above using threats and intimidations, and does not believe you must conquer the world?

Have you 'been there and done that'? Have you at one time perhaps thought you'd found your dream girl, only to find her turned into a nightmare? Are you tired of being alone and waiting for the 'perfect' woman? Are you tired of answering these questions? Good, read on.

Are you are a gent who would appreciate having an authentic loving relationship with a sane, cute, playful and petite BBW, zaftig woman, who does not want to marry or change you? Well then, hop on that mouse and tell me a bit about yourself!

Thanks for reading. Intrigued?

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, inwhich city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay. 
To receive a reply, Please send your Photo and a Descriptive Letter

title: Wanderlust
text:
Grew up in Puerto Rico and the East Village in NYC. Been in the Bay on and off since 2002. Navigating my life towards being a professional performing artist. Have some pretty exciting projects lined up and looking forward to this change in my life. I divide my time between Brooklyn and Berkeley. Making a move to LA in the Fall. 

Looking to meet someone who openly communicates, is down to earth and really fun! I was told by my best friend that I have a type, which I wasn't aware of but here it is: Passionate, wild bohemian spirited,and die hard romantics who have that skater-Surfer vibe like Anthony Keidis. I also like soft eyes and maturity.
My spirit animal is Alana from Broad City.

I'm Puerto Rican. I'm voluptuous/fat. I'm a feminist. A reader. A writer. A film buff. A comedian. A trained cook. 

I'm pretty shy at first but after getting to know me, I can get outrageous . I really value my relationships with friends and whomever I'm seeing. I'm affectionate, loving,intelligent and driven and seek that in a potential partner.My friends say that I am loyal, loving, supportive, playful, passionate,generous and inappropriately hilarious.


Please don't bother writing if you're older than 38 or younger than 27. I won't respond to emails that are "hi". We are all adults and should be able to write a paragraph or two about ourselves.

title: Valentines Day 2017
text:
Well, it's a little less than a year since you responded to my CL ad. . .and I'm so glad you did. It's amazing that we found each other, considering the magnitude of single people in the Bay Area. Having you in my life as best friend, lover, and the last person I want to talk to before I go to sleep, and the first person I want to see in the morning has been wonderful.

That first date was really nice -- we were attracted to each other - both of us physically appealing and dedicated to fitness and good health - and had lots to talk about. And as important, made each other laugh. Things just got better as we started spending more time together, realizing how much we had in common and how much we could learn from each other based on our unique experiences in the world. 

I love that you're always up for a new adventure, whether it's a hike under a bright full moon or a road trip with a reservation at a B and B but everything else left up to what we feel like doing in the moment. The never-ending search for the best dive bar and diner, unusual films, small outdoor blues festivals, favorite and new favorite stand-up comics, and edgy as well as more traditional theater offerings. They're always more enjoyable because I'm with you.

I love that we've each learned about ourselves from past relationships and are clear on what we want and need from each other to keep things balanced and healthy. That we respect and accept each other for who we are and embrace our differences. But, that we communicate well -- not expecting each other to be mind readers. That we enjoy each other's company but can go off and do our own thing - and look forward to reconnecting to share the experience. 

I love that we have a similar sensibility and outlook on life about the importance of environmental, economic and social justice. I may be more of an activist than you, but I appreciate that you let me be who I am and fight the good fight on behalf of those that don't have a voice. 

I believe we bring out the best in each other and make each other want to be more loving, caring and compassionate people - who find the humor in almost everything, laugh a lot, and don't take ourselves too seriously. Happy (almost) one year anniversary. Here's to much more love, fun, and excitement to come.

title: Seeking my Forever Romance Partner
text:
Hello,
I am interested in making a new connection with a special guy who is open to a relationship. He would probably be in his mid forties to early fifties, not a game player, and not looking for a casual fling. text:

However, human beings are wired to seek connections, and nothing replaces companionship, and not just friends and family, agree? While it certainly would be great to meet someone with long-term potential, I'd be happy to make a new friend with whom to share a nice dinner with good conversation. How does that sound?

I'm mainstream and practical in many ways, including being an educated professional with traditional family and relationship values, along with a deep appreciation for chivalry. At the same time, I'm very spiritual, and love connecting with others who similarly have a spiritual life and aren't too hung up on the trappings of the human experience. Beyond that, there's absolutely room to play, banter and have fun.

So, with all that said, if you think you might be interested in breaking bread together, why don't you introduce yourself with enough details to give me a sense of who you are and what you are looking for? Please be reasonably close in age to me, as well as in physical location. Also, you must be single and unattached. Including a picture or two is highly encouraged.

Logistics prevail if I want to get to know someone. (RECENT UPDATE: Before responding to this post please read all the way through to the end)

Although I'm independent I'd like to find a great partner to enjoy this next phase of life with. Perhaps one that has raised his own kids. I'm looking for an established man that has led an interesting life and has good stories to tell. I also have good stories to tell. 

I'm financially stable and seek to find my equal or better with regards to finances. I love the outdoors. Whereas I once used to like to rock climb, backpack and campout under the stars...my tastes for adventure have tamed over the years to easygoing hikes, bike rides, paddle a kayak and sleep in nice, comfortable accommodations. I still enjoy a good road tripping adventure and especially seek to explore more countries. Ask and I'll give you my bucket list. Nobody is flawless but if you have a good sense of humor, try to practice kindness and can use your resources to fix a problem then you're the guy I'd like to meet. 

I'm not in a hurry to "jump in" to a relationship but nor do I want to drag my feet. I consider making friends along the way a bonus. Honestly I'd like to have found a partner years ago but being a full time, single mom hasn't allowed much time for that. 

If any of this sounds good to you. Send me a photo and I'll do the same. Maybe it will go somewhere. Look forward to hearing from you. **RECENT UPDATE: To avoid spam (and those to busy to read to the end) please put your favorite place in the subject line. Thanks and wishing us both luck :)

title: Togetherness
text:
I look for Real Life with it's Real Challenge, Pain, Love, Disappointment, Trust. I'm REAL!
Below you'll read my thoughts about how a relationship between two sophisticated people, the seniors (!), should start.
This is deleted twice a day. I think it doesn't fit the education level of CL population, does it?

I strongly recommend those who look for just sex to pass me by.

Someone said that I'm "edgy". Actually, I'm NOT edgy nor hardened. I'm Transparent, Kind, Warm, but also Selective. And I know that To be Happy Means To Be Understood.
If you overcome a feeling of discomfort caused by the unusual directness of this text, I'll send you my REAL pretty poetic and philosophical, very long profile.

I'm NOT an American nor Asian woman but am a US citizen, who is ready to share my beliefs with you. 
And here it goes.
. 
Before jumping in the man's arms, a smart woman who respects herself, knows who she is and who she looks for, has to see a potential partner in different life situations.

It's NOT about a trip to a restaurant followed by a hookup! NO!

Actually, there isn't too much to find out at 60+ , as the main part of our journey has already been finalized: we've got education, built our careers, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes which we would like to avoid repeating.
Yes, too often we betrayed our inner being for different reasons, and this time we have no right to lie to ourselves.
It seems to me that what a decent and honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is: 

1) how this man relates to her in terms of her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);
2) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" isn't my match for sure.
3) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Man they Can Respect.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire, while not every man wants and is capable of giving himself to the relationship fully. 

I'm a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

4) The eyes are a mirror of the soul. So, the eyes are more important than anything else. Mine are big thinking and smiling eyes, and you can read a lot in them as I'll look Directly into your Soul. 
Appearance of a potential partner is important not only to men but also to women. But men don't need to be "cute"; they need to be Handsome and Manly. 

People say I'm an attractive and elegant lady.

5) the attitude to money and income is usually a deal breaker. None of us is eager to partner a loser or user. In my pretty traditional view, it is normal if a man earns more and acts like a gentleman in any circumstances. On the other hand, to be an independent woman doesn't only mean to be able to support herself, it means to resolve her problems on her own, which I'm used to do successfully. 

In general, interacting of a potential couple with an outside world (not just the super-limited world of their shared bed) can either make them closer or tell them that they are not compatible at all.

People need to feel a click at different levels, and the INTIMACY includes so much! It may start during the hike people go on together, during volunteering, at the concert hall, where they both are thrilled by the performance of an orchestra, when doing charity, promoting business and sometimes helping each other. But accepting help or gifts requires the reciprocation, which a woman at the stage of OBSERVING usually is not ready for. 

I'm deadly tired of both pushing away the jerks from dating sites and of talking with much older men, who want to warn me that my search for True Love with a True Man while having my Very Thick Filters on, is severe and devastating for myself.

I'll try!

I think that, in case I decide to be close to a man, I won't want to move to his place right away. At this age people have completed so many tasks ( study, child rearing, career), that, if they want, like I do, to have a Very Close Relationship with a Like-Minded partner, it's better to really focus on how they feel their togetherness and how they feel interacting with a world as a couple before making a serious decision. They need to stay in their familiar environment, do their jobs...
You remember that I have even a longer text to share with you, right? I bet, you'll impression will be just opposite to the one you've got from reading the text in here...
Your Serious introduction with an image is welcome!

Smile!

I remember a proverb "Hope dies last". Do you?

title: End my lonely hearted dry spell?
text:
5 months is a very long dry spell for me, but given the catastrophic level of heartbreak that occured, it was probably necessary. I'm mostly back to my giggling, flirtatious self. Unfortunately, efforts to find a suitable tall drink of water have been mostly fruitless with the exception of a few rainy night fumblings in a car with a hot chef. Fun yet frustratingly adolescent, and leaving me feeling no less virginal.

People are so blase about casual sex these days, but I need to be treated differently. More respect and patience is required to score with me. So the months of lonely nights continue. My 39th birthday is in about a month and my sole wish is to be sexually active again.

The first problem is geographic. I live/work/play in San Francisco and can't host due to my squished housing crisis situation. So a man must provide four walls and a bed within lyft distance of downtown San Francisco. And not just for a one night stand.

I'm also in need of a sexually attractive man roughly 28-48 who is single, intelligent, and with good manners. Mad seduction skills. I know, who do I think I am, asking for so much. Right? I should just settle for a drunken poke in an alley with the first guy who offers, but I just can't. I need quality.

If this sounds like the job for you, please write to me with photos. Please. Don't write to me with no photos.

I'm a very curvy, fat, full figured and shapely plus sized woman. Very fair skin, long dark hair, pretty face, killer style, youthful, ultra feminine. If I sound like your general type, you will be pleased. I'm also very experienced in matters of the heart and sex, while still somehow maintaining an air of innocence, vulnerability, even naivete.

I'm not sure how I will ever fall into bed with a man again. My guard is so up, I'm feeling so protective of myself, and not very patient with men. It will take a special level of skill to solve this problem. Help!

title: let me scratch your BACK and you scratch mine
text:
Hello, I go through ads on Craigslist and other personals, dating sites and apps, etc. Not unlike myself, I notice a lot of men simply looking to connect with someone. To talk to, to relate with on whatever you're going through and in that same regard there are those seeking to care for someone who needs companionship. I've met some of the best men this way, and have found myself looking forward to leaving work and going straight home to chat online with him. Technology has been kind in helping make the experience even more fulfilling. We all need something, but other needs can interrupt the happiness and satisfaction connecting with a perfect stranger can bring us. Let me get to my point. I'm a single parent of a one year old child. I barely have an income, and when I say barely I mean less than 750$ per month sometimes. I'm doing my best in being a devoted mother to my son and to keep my morals in tact which is probably something I wouldn't have done in the past had I been having these kinds of money problems in the past. So I'd like to try something new. I'm not opposed to meeting in person but the idea in my head is more like connecting with a man who is looking for a friend, someone to flirt with, dream about, hang out on our web cams together and allow yourself to be 100% comfortable with being you and not fear being vulnerability because I'll be right there doing the same with you and just help each other.

If you're a man who wants to go there with ne and has the means to help my tiny family with whatever you feel, I wanna give you my time and a part of my heart as gratitude for at least offering me some peace of mind. I want someone to make me feel like its gonna be ok and I wanna do the same for them. 

Email me something about you and let's take it from there. Ill exchange pictures via email as well.

title: Genuine Friendship, Slow Erotica, Eventually Live Together
text:
It's been lonely living alone all these years. It feels even lonelier when I face leaving the expensive Bay Area when I retire in five years, moving far away, all alone, leaving my friends and life here. Therefore, I seek a man, within 8 years of age 60, living no more than one hour from San Mateo, CA, where after 1-2 years of dating, we move in together, agreeing on retirement options. However, years ago, I made an oath I'd rather be lonely than in a bad relationship, having been alone now for almost eight years, the longest I've ever been alone. 

I simply seek a happy enough relationship which involves we enjoy each other's social and erotic company and don't argue over money. Socially I enjoy: city culture, (live concerts/especially jazz vocals, ballet, museums and movies) outdoor beauty, (nature strolls, easy cycling/kayaking and hot springs) and emotional stability/maturity with honest integrity to offer genuine friendship. Although I am no longer idealistic as I was in my youth, having embraced life's ironies at age 60, my youthful hippy liberal values still persevere. Erotically, I am the slow sensual type, bordering on tantra, open to minor kink and need total monogamy. I'm usually drawn to guys who keep themselves relatively in shape, I making it the gym 2-3/week and doing some yoga. Financially, I only earn $70,000, but have no debt and significantly save. I don't eat out much, preferring to spend my expendable income on concerts. I eat simply, mostly soups, salads and stir fries, eating mostly vegetables with meat to flavor. Although I'm healthy, taking no meds, I have some minor ankle arthritis and am a carrier of HVS 2. As I rent, I'll certainly have to move when I retire. At this point, I'm considering buying a small home in Eugene, Oregon, a small college town with culture, but open to other areas.

title: This is Like Putting a Note in a Bottle and Throwing into The Ocean...
text:
I don't know if i can find anyone on this service. I can only describe what i am like and what i am looking for, then hope for the best.


I am pretty special and people always remember my face, even if i don't remember theirs.
It's hard to describe why, but i am racially mixed, like to wear artful clothing and jewelry, 
have long hair (no, it's not white, it's still dark but for 2 white hairs). People say i am pretty, and look a little younger than my age. I am on the feminine side (not 100%).

Also, i am really fun, make you laugh a lot (i am trying my hand at stand up comEdy so you can be my audience, OK?), lovable, intelligent, educated


What i am looking for is love, trust, a relationship and friendship, hopefully, if that can be found here. Sadly, this site is so full of pornography that people seem to think that that is all it's about,and just send pictures of their genitals. Hey, don't send that to me. I am never going to answer you if you do. 

I want a genuine, loving, creative, local guy (within the bay area, not off in Fresno or Modesto or something like that....no good to make lots of global warming) who wants to have a real friend and hopefully real love. If you want to start really slowly and carefully that is good for me.


I am in very early 50s, and seek someone around 45--54 (not much out of this range please).
You must be non-smoker, no drugs or other vices (being a workaholic is a vice to me. I want someone with time to be together and have fun).

My preference is medium dark to dark skin, dark hair, not too tall and not fat. Sorry, i don't go for blonds or really light skin and eyes. I am on the small side and have some leftover pounds from being a mama, but it is disappearing with all the dance classes i go to. I like the gym as well and we can go together if you like. 

You still have your hair, or most of it, NOT bald or shaved head please ( yes, i have mine, and it's long, and growing).

I have a big preference for guys who love humor, smile, treat me really well, have a good relationship with their families and don't shy away from commitment.

Here is one important point: I don't like TV. If you really like it and watch it a lot this won't work out.
I don't even have one and don't plan on getting one. I am too busy, for one, but besides that, i can't stand commercials, and frankly, i don't like to sit and watch it. To me that is just wasting life itself.

I want someone who loves to dance (my likes are cumbia, samba, Mexican music, Zydeco at Ashkenaz is fun, reggae is OK) so we can enjoy that together.

KPFA 94.1 FM is on a lot at my place, and i participate in a lot of the marches and demonstrations announced there, so i want a progressive like myself, into progressive movements like Black Lives Matter (Brown Lives too), Living Wage, Stop Gentrification, Immigration Reform, and the like. 

A lot of my time goes to dance classes, and there is a summer college class i am starting pretty soon. I do have time on weekends and love to be together then. I love to go to street fairs, programs at Ashkenaz or La Pen~a or Mission Cultural Center, throw parties or dinners, weave (yes, i do this) and do other art-y things, try new places and things. 

I like to take photos and am trying to learn to make good video.
If you have similar interests maybe we should meet up. Please tell me about yourself and what your interests are, what you do for a living, where you live, if you have kids, etc. Please write enough so i will know if this is worth pursuing.

If you are vegetarian that is cool. I am not but don't eat any red meat, and usually avoid dairy too. I list4en to Mario Martinez on KPFA and he says that those who live to be 100 are Not vegetarians. . ..interesting. . ..but i don't eat red meat because It is not too healthy and it is not sustainable for our planet. . ...for the same reason, i don't want anyone far away. . .Global warming sucks, so let's avoid long drives OK?

I am single mom (only one kid, now a teenager) and the two of us live alone together. It would be nice to find a person that eventually will be my partner, so we can live together. I live Bay Area, not too far from San Francisco (i know, it is expensive). I am not too into the suburbs.

Please make sure you really want a friend/partner before you respond. I am pretty tired of these people who disappear after 3 or 5 emails or calls before we even meet. It makes me think they are married (if you are, or if you have a girlfriend or anything similar please DO NOT respond! Single guys only).

You have to be into long, deep conversations, good at listening and talking, value upfront verbal communication and being straightforward. I am very straightforward, and don't like silence or non verbal gestures that don't speak outright. We are not mind readers and should not have to be.

Please send me your photo when you reply, a good photo that shows your face clearly. I can send you mine if this looks like it has potential.

Apparently the kid who he had been working with for the last few years is no longer a pussy and isn't afraid of the dark anymore. title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, inwhich city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay.

First things first: I'm not looking for a hook-up or a FWB! If that's all you're looking for, please don't message me! I'm also not into hanging out for only a week, so I'm not interested in guys who are on vacation in the area. 

I'm Filipina (born and raised in the USA), cute, short (at just about 5'1") and would consider myself a small BBW that carries herself well and I also have a great smile. I'm looking for someone to become friends with, with the possibility of a long term relationship, but I'm definitely not trying to rush anything. I really do want to find that special someone to share laughter and life with. I'm quirky, love sarcasm, can be quiet at times, but I'm outgoing and friendly, and know how to let loose and have fun. I have a good head on my shoulders, have manners, and know how to behave in public. I have no tolerance for liars, cheaters, or guys who are still in love with their ex. 

I'm attracted to white guys (that's pretty much all I'm attracted to, so it's very obvious to see who didn't actually read this) and it's important that you're single with no kids, non-ghetto, and non-cigarette smoking. I'm looking for someone in the age range of 27-37 and within a reasonable distance to central Contra Costa. 

If you're interested after reading this, send me an email with a face picture. I have plenty to trade! =)

title: Smart and Sexy Looking for Guy to make her Laugh 45- 59
text:
There's nothing better than spending time together with a man that's smart, creative, and a bit sexy. And one who enjoys going to farmer's market for fresh produce!

I'm 5'3, - and in shape, as I enjoy working out. I'm stable, sane, employed, and have my own home. I enjoy cultural outings, outdoor activities, and the genuine companionship of someone in a similar life situation whose interests match my own. I'm well read, politically astute, and enjoy a great conversation.

Now for the harder stuff: I'm looking to expand my social life and possibly meet someone special. A friend first that evolves and grows into something more. I think the best couples are friends as well as lovers.

I'm looking for a SWM professional (white collar) guy who is grounded, reliable, and introspective. Someone who is comfortable enough in his own skin to see the humor in life's ups and downs and can laugh at himself. Someone close to my age who lives nearby. I live in Concord (boring, I know!!)

I like to spend time hanging out in the City catching some lunch or checking out an art gallery and then a hike and out for drinks. Maybe swimming out here in the east bay, being lazy in the sun for a bit, and then going to a movie. Or maybe you teach me something totally out of my comfort zone.

I like fast cars and guys who enjoy speed. Not much beats taking a drive with the top down and the music up loud. I like going out dancing and there is something so sensual as being in the arms of a man on the dance floor.

I like people who enjoy taking a risk and going to new places and trying new items on the menu. You never know until you give it a try!

I also enjoy that connection to spirituality, whatever that means for each of us. I believe there is a greater power out there and that gives me a lot of satisfaction and peace. I'm a beginner when it comes to meditation but spending some quiet time going inward helps me deal with life's challenges.

I'm attracted to a confident man - one who is driven by the need to succeed - but who also has another side to him. A funny, silly side. And understands the work/life balance. And, who when teased, can laugh at himself a bit. 

If my posting interests you, please respond back with your information- age, hobbies and background, and a picture.

A little about me, I am 5ft, 7in, have a curvy body type. I am active I enjoy walking on the beach or West Cliff, swimming. I also enjoy TV and getting into TV shows. I love animals especially dogs and horses. I don't do any drugs or smoke and drink very rarely. It is a dream of mind to one day be able to live on property and have horses and other animals. I have a job that I love, a car, house, and am happy with my life and where it is at, I am not looking for anyone to complete me or anything. title: Wanna help me Garden? Share organic veggies?
text: Well I am getting older, but still young at heart. Usually I feel fairly cheerful when in good company, gardening, hiking, or playing music, but recently I have to stand up with Bernie Sanders and shout "Enough is Enough!" Yes, I am leftwing, organic, very grounded in the earth, scared to death by what is going on politically, environmentally, socially, economically. Still trying to fight the good fight and do the right thing and all that stuff, but it sure would be easier to do it with someone else. Do you like to garden? Time to plant and I need some help. And I'd share the vegetables and cook you something with them. It would be a gentle way to get to know someone, to see if there is a cooperative spirit, an appreciation of nature. A friendship? and maybe more. Maybe. That would be nice. I don't think its a fairytale that two people are supposed to grow old together helping each other down the pay, lightening each other's load, brightening each other's day. You should be somewhere between 58 AND 68, not be a smoker, and not drink much. Must like cats, be kind to children, have a good sense of humor, be able to be silly, but be very serious and solid in your core. An artistic or musical streak would be appreciated.

title: Seeking a new best friend / partner / companion / lover
text:
. . .just one man who is age-appropriate (60-75), close in geography (I live mid-peninsula), and similarly inclined (read on).

Neither of us is currently partnered, and we crave the steadfast companionship and deep intimacy we have experienced and expressed in past monogamous relationships. Living long has made us far wiser than we were in our youth. We acknowledge our imperfections and recognize that understanding, compassion, affection, and acceptance are essential to a lasting relationship.

We are both intelligent, articulate people, active and involved, socially and politically liberal, and financially stable. We're still healthy, energetic, and attractive, and we intend to keep ourselves that way for many years to come.

Here are some specifics about me:

I am HWP (5'4" tall, ~137 lbs.) and Caucasian. Raised east-coast Jewish, for the past two decades I have been an active member of a progressive religious community that includes people of all persuasions. I am omnivorous, and get along best with those similarly inclined. Semi-retired now, I continue to seek ways to contribute my experience and energy to people and projects that make a difference in the world. Among the pastimes I enjoy are music and dancing, puzzles, cooking and savoring good food and beverage, hiking and exploring (especially with my canine companion), flowers and plants, computers and the Internet, movies and some TV, home maintenance and renovation. My social and political leanings are decidedly liberal/progressive.

If you resonate with this post, I hope you'll write to tell me about yourself (age and location are essential!), what you're looking for, why you're responding. When you do, please attach a current photo; I will happily reciprocate if we seem to be a match.

title: Spiritual, Sentient, Selective

title: Long term
text:
First let me start off by saying I'm a "bigger girl" so if you aren't into that then please hit the back button or exit out. When I say I'm a "bigger girl" I don't mean super plus size but more like a size 12. I'm Latina, I have a big bum and I'm very pretty.

One very important factor in finding a partner is my love for daddy/daughter role play. In public we are a loving, normal couple and behind closed doors we have this relationship. You being my daddy domme and I, your good girl. 

I'm college educated and although I could have a "big girl job" I choose to work a simple job that gives me time to work on my art. If that bothers you then this won't work out. Having a creative outlet is a 100% must for me. My job is fun, pays the bills, and I'm still able to afford my own apartment in the city. It's not a luxurious high rise but it's my own space and I love it.

Things that I enjoy...

I'm very into fashion. I appreciate fabric, construction, I love nice things. I always look put together and I'd like to date someone that's also fashionably conscious. 

I'm a foodie. If your idea of a date is going to Olive Garden (I've never been) or some chain restaurant then this won't work out. The city is full of amazing restaurants and trying a new place is part of what makes living here so fun. With that being said, I'm not sure I'll stand in line for two hours for a bagel. That's a bit extreme plus you can use postmates or some other app and not have to wait. 

Some days I just want to stay in and cuddle. I love cooking and having a partner that cooks would be nice. I've always wanted to take one of those couples cooking classes. Yes I know how silly that is but I still want to do it and hopefully you'd be open enough to just go along with it. 

Art.

Netflix marathons. You have to be able to binge watch with me. Not all the time but it will happen and I'll lay on the couch with my head in your lap and we'll get through all the seasons. Haha. Okay...maybe not all but most. 

I love weekend trips. I love getting lost on Airbnb and favoriting places to visit. I'm someone that wants to stay in a treehouse in the middle of nowhere and in the cute little camper. I'm also down for a nice hotel but appreciate kitschy more. 

Music...very broad in what I like. Pretty much anything but prefer indie/folk. I do not like any of that rave edm music. 

Being outside, museums, going for drives, taking photos, being silly, making things, collecting twigs, painting, laughing, going for walks, going to all the cute coffee shops, puzzles, alameda flea market, gardening, reading...idk what else to list. 

I'm not religious but do believe in a higher being. 

I'm looking for someone who is older than me, college educated, nerdy, dorky, preferably tall, mostly attracted to white guys but I'm open, family oriented, genuinely nice and must have a positive outlook on life. I'm someone that's always in a good mood and would like the same in a partner. 

I'm not sure what else to add and realize that it is now 3am and I'm very sleepy and probably didn't do my best writing this. But that's okay. 

If I've peaked your interest please respond and attach a photo. Tell me about yourself and what you are looking for.

You= not republican 

Must have really good hygiene 

Also very into bearded men so bonus points for that.

title: Sharing Happiness
text:
Hello,

I am into Spirituality, not religion. I enjoy writing stories and poems, playing with watercolors, and sipping tea/coffee over engaging conversation. I'm fairly close to downtown Los Gatos and would prefer someone in the south bay area or Santa Cruz area. 

What I'm doing with my life 
I live in the Santa Cruz Mountains in a redwood forest and I have a lovely home....with sunshine! It is wonderful up here. I enjoy playing in the mud (gardening) and visiting with my friends the deer. They are cute, especially the babies. I'm having a lot of fun writing a novel. 
I'm really good at 
Communicating with people, having fun and enjoying life. I'm a good listener and I love talking with people. I am a curious person and people are very interesting to me. I also naturally validate people as I notice what people are doing/saying. I do it with sincerity and a loving heart. 

The first things people usually notice about me 
I'm very warm, friendly, and easy to be with. I naturally encourage people. I notice nature and truly appreciate all the beauty that surrounds us. 

Favorite books, movies, shows, music, and food 
I'm enjoying reading the work of Colum McCann. I love the poet Rumi, Sci-fi, Scott Orsen Card, books about investing and real estate, and about quantum physics, reading Michio Kaku, Amit Goswami, PhD, a good novel, old classic movies, buttered popcorn and almost all food. 

The six things I could never do without 
Being close, family, love, fun, new experiences and new thoughts, relaxing, being creative, noticing and appreciating nature and the magic of life. Oops more than six. :-) 
I spend a lot of time thinking about 
Being intimate with my beloved, traveling and having adventures. Cuddling, flirting. playing, talking, watching a movie and being together. 

On a typical Friday night I am 
Having dinner and a movie with friends or home watching a movie or reading. 

The most private thing I'm willing to admit 
I hired a handyman to check my mouse trap! 

You should message me if

title: Slightly bruised seeks articulate, creative, erotic, whip-smart penpal
text:
Hi.

I'm seeking something a little different. I recently got out of a long-term relationship that ended incredibly badly, and I'm still pretty bruised by it. As much as I can miss big parts of what it was like to be in a relationship, I really need to take some "me time" and spend a while recovering. So while I could start dating or find a FWB, I realize that's not really what's best for me right now, even if part of that appeals.

But I miss connection, and I've always been someone who has lived through her words and thoughts pretty intensely. So I thought: maybe I could find an online pen pal -- someone to express my thoughts with, talk about everything from the world around to relationships to sexuality, all while giving myself space to heal, too?

I'm in my early 30s, intelligent, with a good life (outside of relationships), athletic and outdoorsy, good at expressing myself and a loyal friend/partner/whatever. I've primarily dated men, but have been curious about more, so this is a w4w ad, as well as w4m.

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, in which city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay. 
** To receive a reply, Please send your Photo and a Descriptive Letter **

title: So tell me, is it true that ... ?
text:
An acquaintance tells me that the best way to get over someone is to get under someone else. What do you think - is it true?

My heart is still raw. I long for the touch of a man's large hand, gently brushing my hair out of my face as he caresses my cheek. I so miss soft, fuzzy kisses on my shoulder and neck. I would love to be folded up into strong arms and held close enough to feel another heart beat. I so want to feel safe again, to know that a man has my back and wants to take care of me.

However, I am hesitant, wary, untrusting, and suspicious. I don't want to go thru heartbreak like this again. Is it worth the risk? Does anyone ever fall in love again after 55? Is it even possible to trust someone enough again to be intimate, to trust someone enough to let them into the depths of my body and soul after having been thrown away like a worn out rag?

I'm not looking to be dominated or to be dominant, I don't want to be someone's MILF or cougar, I'm not into threesomes, I'm not polyamorous, I don't want to be your mistress, I'm not looking for a quick lay. It seems that those are most of the desired qualities of men's posts on Craigs.

I am looking for a man who is emotionally available and knows how and when to talk, and who knows how and when to listen. I am looking for someone who doesn't necessarily agree with me on everything, but who can respect that I have my own valid opinions and wants to hear them. I am a giver and a toucher, and I hope to find a man who can handle those qualities and return them in his own authentic way.

If you choose to reply to this post, please be local to the North Bay area, and please don't be offensive or crude - I don't need or want it. Thanks for reading.

55 - 65

title: Once upon a time...
text:
there was a woman who lived in San Francisco and after her "forever" prince turned to brass, she went in search of her Knight in Shining Armor (the real deal, not the stuff that turns green), the one who would sweep her off her feet, be her Renaissance Man, and love, respect, and cherish her for their happily after. 

After trying to spin straw into gold for one of her suitors, she learned he was only interested in the gold and not the special talents and qualities that she possesses. He wanted only the brand new gold, not realizing that gold never tarnishes and failed to realize that this craft took years of patience, skill and maturity to master. She didn't lose heart.

Her next suitor tried to awaken her passions to him with a kiss, not realizing that a woman of her caliber though passionate for the right Knight, wasn't an easy score. He tried to ply her with words of empty affection, promises of great intimacy, telling her things she wanted to hear and not the truth, in order to seduce her into his bed chambers. This didn't work but she kept her hopes high.

Next up was a very young suitor who was enamored with the notion of a cultured, experienced, intelligent woman who could educate and teach him things in the arts of love and though she was not particularly attractive and somewhat full figured which might turn off some, he ardently pursued her so that she could teach him these things. She gently put aside his affections because she knew she wanted a full, mature Knight who knew what he wanted and could care and cherish her. She still believes her Knight in shining armor is out there.

Are you the Knight she has been seeking these past few years to find? The one who eclipses all of her former suitors? If you think chivalry is alive and well, please reply to this posting. Please write as if you were sending a message to your future wife and tell her about why you are the Knight in Shining Armour she has been searching for.

title: Cute, happy & goal-oriented seeking the same
text:
First things first: I have herpes. I am NOT looking for casual sex and am only saying this up front to screen out anyone that has a problem with it. I contracted herpes (aka HSV) the first time I had sex so my ENTIRE sexual life has consisted of me establishing a trusting relationship first, having the "talk", and then intimacy. I don't know how to approach sex any other way and I don't want to. If you are interested only in sex, I'm probably not a good match. 

I am a mix of white/Asian. I am in my late 30's but am often told that I look much younger. I wear a size 8 (or medium) in women's clothing and am curvy (big breasts/hips) but not fat but not skinny either. I guess I consider myself hwp. I am financially successful and have great friends. I am active and work out regularly. 

I smile and laugh a lot and tend to be optimistic, encouraging and nurturing. I am kind, genuinely care about others, and am sometimes too trusting. People who don't know me well tend to think I'm bubbly and carefree while those close to me would describe me as being driven and accomplished. People also mistake me for being extraverted (I am often described as "fun" or "sociable") but I'm actually an introvert and like my downtime. I tend to be slow at establishing sexual intimacy. I am normally abstinent for long periods of time in between boyfriends and move slowly towards sexual intimacy in new relationships. Once I am in a sexual relationship though, I tend to have a high sex drive, am very open about my desires and my body (only with my lover, though, since I am not interested in having multiple partners), and enjoy experimentation. So please be gentlemanly enough to respect my limits (especially at the beginning of the relationship) but naughty enough to push them a bit later. 

Except for the guy who gave me herpes and maybe a couple of other experiences, I have had mostly great experiences with men so I don't have that sort of baggage. Most of my exes were also my best friends and continued to respect and care for me long after the relationship was over. I am honest, loyal and have never cheated on anyone so you will not have to worry about those kinds of issues with me. I do, however, have issues with relying on others. I've been self-reliant and fiercely independent for most of my life and have a tendency to close myself off and hunker down on my goals when I face a problem. But I'm older now and am rethinking my priorities and have decided that I want to go about things a little differently. I want a partner in life -- someone that I can face life's challenges with together -- and I now know that the only way I can find a partner is by allowing some to be a partner. So please be honest, trustworthy, responsible, dependable and reliable since I won't allow myself to be with anything less. I promise to be the same in return.

I think I said enough about myself for now. If I interest you and you think you might be what I'm looking for, then please write. Please be in your 30's/early 40's. I will not respond to spam, one-liners, men who obviously didn't read my ad or responses where I sense deception.
hiv/hsv/hpv: No HIV but am HSV Postive

title: Looking for a boyfriend... (original title, I know.)
text:
What am I looking for? I'm looking for a relationship with someone who I can connect with. And I'm not a fan of being the third wheel on double dates.

Remind me never to do blind dates again... the last one backfired on me, so I think I'd like to try getting to know a guy on my own rather than have a girlfriend set me up.

A little bit about me. I'd like to think I'm low-key, low maintenance date. I'm very easy going with a great personality, and I love to laugh. I'm a little chubby, about a size 16 dress. I'm a bit short, barely over 5'.

I don't need a dinner at the French Laundry and a trip to Bora Bora every week to make me happy (Although, if you do offer me a trip to Bora Bora I most likely will not turn you down). Honestly, I've been meaning to go out for Laser tag, and would enjoy going with someone. Local day trips, walks/hikes, things to do on the weekend are among the things I like. I will admit to singing in the car and shower, and I like to enjoy all of the little things in life.

I'd like someone who I can go on dates with as well as have a great night in. I prefer a cozy night in cuddling watching Netflix as opposed to the bar scene. I want to find someone who I'm comfortable with doing something and doing nothing with. I love messaging and/or calling periodically throughout the day. I don't need to spend every waking moment in communication with you, but a little bit of texting and a call or two wouldn't hurt. I like hearing from my partner.

I need someone who understands that I'm not going to jump into bed on the first date with. If I wanted a quick lay, I'd be posting in the casual encounters section. I don't need more drama in my life, so please... But don't take that as I never want to talk with you; I really do enjoy conversation. I'd just prefer if I didn't have any of your friends or exes or family trying to blow me up or kill me for whatever god knows reason when I haven't done anything wrong. I like myself intact, in one piece, and uninjured thanks. :) I'd really like to keep it that way.

If you'd like to know more about me, just ask!

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, in which city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

title: Rainy day experiment
text:
OK, so Craigslist might not the first place that comes to mind to meet a "normal guy" when it comes to having an LTR, but a colleague met her now spouse this way years ago, so I figured, let's see what the proverbial storms may bring in this rainy day.

About Me: 
I'm a SWF cute brunette who stands tall at 5'2". 
I'm a city girl who lives and works in San Francisco (have called the Mission home for the past 12 years) but originally from Chicago, so you could say I have good ol' fashioned midwestern values. 
I stay active going to the gym, yoga, biking, and taking my dog on "urban hikes." 
I like to check out new restaurants, cook, see live music at venues like The Independent and Fillmore and global travel adventures (most recently to Cuba). 
I'm not a drama queen and have little tolerance for it.

About You: 
Straight, single male, in your 40s, fit and attractive (you don't need to be Greek god, but you're no slouch either), mentally stable, emotionally mature and financially independent. 
Your sense of humor is more of the dry and sarcastic variety, rather than slapstick. 
You're smart and engaged with what's going on in our world. 
You're honest and loyal. 
You value your family and friends. 
You live or work in San Francisco (I'm not into long distance dating and would consider San Jose to be long distance). 
Bonus points if you're a dog-person. 
You're ultimately looking for a LTR but willing to give this Craigslist thing a shot and take one step at a time to see where it may lead you.

I'm not one for endless back and forth emails/texts, as I'd much rather meet up for a drink or coffee to see if there's a connection. But first things first, send me a note with a pic and do tell me a little more info about yourself, and we can take it from there.

title: Seeking honorable gentleman for this warm-hearted lady
text:
People say they first notice my bright smile, friendly personality, and they say that I'm easy to talk too. I'm a good listener and will only give advice when asked. I've got a good sense of humor and love to laugh - but always in good taste. I'm a straight-shooter and as genuine and sincere as they come. I'm laid back and down to earth but I get very passionate over various topics. I work with kids, I love what I do, and I'm really good at it. I put my heart and soul into everything that I do. Living a active, healthy lifestyle is paramount to me - I'm not good for anybody, let alone myself, if I don't take good care of my mind, heart, and body. I'm detailed, organized, and admittedly "slightly" OCD... but just on some things ;-)

I consider myself to be a modern woman who enjoys the freedom and independence that a good job provides but I'm also old-fashioned in my desire to find a clean-cut man with similar beliefs and character qualities that make him stand out as a strong, humble leader who's confident in who he is, where he came from, and passionate about where he's going in life and he'd like nothing more than for us to join forces together as a team. I'm hoping to find that rare honorable gentleman who is wise, kind, caring, thoughtful, selfless, loyal, generously affectionate and totally over the moon about me - and me for him. I want us both to encourage, build up, and challenge one another to learn and grow and even call each other out (in love) when necessary. I want us to rejoice in each other's strengths and lend a helping hand in each other's weaknesses.

My ideal match would be a healthy, physically fit Caucasian, 6' to 6'2" with strong broad shoulders and a manly frame that compliments my strong, curvy frame. He'd be between 35-47 have his life in order and not be given over to any vices; single, divorced, or widowed; no kids or share 50/50 custody with his amicable ex. title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

I'm generally considered to be beautiful, but also overweight. I have a very curvy pear shaped body type, plus a large bust. Fair skinned with dark hair and very feminine. Maybe because I'm a larger woman, men assume I'm easy or have low self-esteem. Maybe it's all of these things. I just can't seem to find men who can talk to me like a human being, but are also interested in me.
