title: Dating LTR/Romance Needed
text:
I have really bad scars from an accident I had as a child. **The photo is a picture of an ex model turned burnsurvivor named Turia Pitt. ** I read about her story and how her relationship was able to pull through the trauma of her accident. Although it's a bit of a reach for me, I am hopeful that despite the absence of the right guy, its possible for me too. 

So coupled with the outcome of my injury and growing up in a conservative household, I consider myself a bit of a late bloomer. The scars on my face are my biggest regret because as you can imagine people's stares aren't always kind. So in anticipation of eye contact, I tend to look away. Trust me, I'm working on it and it's getting better with time. 

My personality is adaptable. In many instances like work and school, I'm a social butterfly and a relatively confident person. But when it comes to social environments where I'm meeting people who aren't familiar with me and especially where dating or flirting happens, I tend to flounder and not know what to do... While this seems like a venting session, I'd like to hope there's someone who's out there who can relate and or want to get to know me, despite the obvious challenges I'm getting over.

I have made some strides in the dating area, I guess. The other day I met someone I was chatting with from tinder and it went fine. We met once after a few days and then another time after a few weeks of talking. I just don't think it's going anywhere because subtle things indicated that he didn't respect me or my time... I'll leave it at that. But for some reason a few days after the second meet up we just stopped checking in. Despite that upset, I did learn through that experience that in spite of feeling singled out and unlovable; I realized how many, if not all people sometimes feel that way. 

Simply put by a bar buddy I met at the Continental Dinner while waiting forty-five minutes for my date to arrive (oops, I said I wouldn't get into that), the buddy said we all have scars and experience trauma. Its just that some of your scars show on the outside. As simple and obvious as that may seem, it meant the world to me to feel that even for a second, I wasn't as different as my appearance and interactions lead me to sometimes feel and believe. Needless to say, I'm working on myself but am certainly not a push over (so you preying wolf, stay away!) 

If you're interested in getting to know someone like myself and maybe hangout, shoot me a message by telling me about yourself and attach a picture of yourself. Here's some of the things I hope you're like:

Friendly, Respectful
Single, No kids, Never married
Educated, Employed, Ambitious
27-35 age **
5'9 height or taller *
Stylish/Well groomed

More About Me----> I'll send you my picture once you send yours. I'm an African American educated female, 5'10, slim build, dark toned skin, and I have a great smile. I know it may seem like I'm asking for a lot but hey why limit your hearts desire. Prayers up. :) Thats it for now...

title: Looking for my partner in crime
text: Hi there! I'm just wondering where all the decent non-whacko guys have gone?? I mean, I know this is Craigslist and all, but I seriously am wondering if there are still some chivalrous, kind, and genuine guys out there. I'm really not going to write out a huge list of please have and please have nots like some of the ads on here have. That's great if you're looking for your soulmate, by tomorrow lol, but not for just finding awesome people to hang out with and see where it goes. I'm a fairly laid back California native, and I'm just looking for someone to hang out with that won't be a super stalker or wants to pick out a wedding venue on the 3rd date. I mean, that's like a 6th date conversation, maybe 7th, lol. So kidding ;-) I refuse to believe chivalry is dead and I'm sure there has to be a guy out there who wants to join me on activities similar to these: random adventures into SF, day trips to the beach or lakes/river etc, drinking a little too much wine and watching a funny movie, or just hanging out at home cooking up something amazing for dinner. Good cuddlers and amazing huggers are encouraged to apply :-) I'm the anti-chick in that I'm not looking for something super serious from the first email exchange we will have. I just want to connect with someone and find someone who enjoys my company as much as I enjoy theirs. All I ask is that you are: not a tobacco smoker, not married or otherwise romantically involved, gainfully employed, not looking for a hookup, somewhat around my age (around 24-38 but not super picky about it), taller than me is preferable, not more than 30 min away from Walnut Creek, and real. Please include a pic and change the subject to "Partner in Crime" to weed out spam. Please only email if you are really interested in getting to know me and hanging out. Before my first ad got flagged yesterday, I received a bunch of replies but so many people flaked out after the initial email. Anyways, thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you soon!

title: Sharing Happiness
text:
Hello,

I am a very passionate person and I'm filled with the joy of life. I'm looking for my best friend and the love of my life to share all the magic and experiences of living. I own my business and I'm semi-retired. I love to travel and explore. I enjoy walking, hiking, jogging, water and the mountains, traveling in the US and in Europe, night life in the cities, most kinds of food, a nice glass of red wine with dinner and exploring.

I am into Spirituality, not religion. I enjoy writing stories and poems, playing with watercolors, and sipping tea/coffee over engaging conversation. I'm fairly close to downtown Los Gatos and would prefer someone in the south bay area or Santa Cruz area. 

What I'm doing with my life 
I live in the Santa Cruz Mountains in a redwood forest and I have a lovely home....with sunshine! It is wonderful up here. I enjoy playing in the mud (gardening) and visiting with my friends the deer. They are cute, especially the babies. I'm having a lot of fun writing a novel. 
I'm really good at 
Communicating with people, having fun and enjoying life. I'm a good listener and I love talking with people. I am a curious person and people are very interesting to me. I also naturally validate people as I notice what people are doing/saying. I do it with sincerity and a loving heart. 

The first things people usually notice about me 
I'm very warm, friendly, and easy to be with. I naturally encourage people. I notice nature and truly appreciate all the beauty that surrounds us. 

Favorite books, movies, shows, music, and food 
I'm enjoying reading the work of Colum McCann. I love the poet Rumi, Sci-fi, Scott Orsen Card, books about investing and real estate, and about quantum physics, reading Michio Kaku, Amit Goswami, PhD, a good novel, old classic movies, buttered popcorn and almost all food. 

The six things I could never do without 
Being close, family, love, fun, new experiences and new thoughts, relaxing, being creative, noticing and appreciating nature and the magic of life. Oops more than six. :-) 
I spend a lot of time thinking about 
Being intimate with my beloved, traveling and having adventures. Cuddling, flirting. playing, talking, watching a movie and being together. 

On a typical Friday night I am 
Having dinner and a movie with friends or home watching a movie or reading. 

The most private thing I'm willing to admit 
I hired a handyman to check my mouse trap! 

You should message me if 
You laughed recently and would like to meet for tea/coffee.

title: Slightly bruised seeks articulate, creative, erotic, whip-smart penpal
text:
Hi.

I'm seeking something a little different. I recently got out of a long-term relationship that ended incredibly badly, and I'm still pretty bruised by it. As much as I can miss big parts of what it was like to be in a relationship, I really need to take some "me time" and spend a while recovering. So while I could start dating or find a FWB, I realize that's not really what's best for me right now, even if part of that appeals.

But I miss connection, and I've always been someone who has lived through her words and thoughts pretty intensely. So I thought: maybe I could find an online pen pal -- someone to express my thoughts with, talk about everything from the world around to relationships to sexuality, all while giving myself space to heal, too?

I'm in my early 30s, intelligent, with a good life (outside of relationships), athletic and outdoorsy, good at expressing myself and a loyal friend/partner/whatever. I've primarily dated men, but have been curious about more, so this is a w4w ad, as well as w4m. 

If this sounds like something you might be interested in, let me know. I have no idea what I'll get in response, but I thought I'd try.

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, in which city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay. 
** To receive a reply, Please send your Photo and a Descriptive Letter **

title: So tell me, is it true that ... ?
text:
An acquaintance tells me that the best way to get over someone is to get under someone else. What do you think - is it true?

My heart is still raw. I long for the touch of a man's large hand, gently brushing my hair out of my face as he caresses my cheek. I so miss soft, fuzzy kisses on my shoulder and neck. I would love to be folded up into strong arms and held close enough to feel another heart beat. I so want to feel safe again, to know that a man has my back and wants to take care of me.

However, I am hesitant, wary, untrusting, and suspicious. I don't want to go thru heartbreak like this again. Is it worth the risk? Does anyone ever fall in love again after 55? Is it even possible to trust someone enough again to be intimate, to trust someone enough to let them into the depths of my body and soul after having been thrown away like a worn out rag?

I'm not looking to be dominated or to be dominant, I don't want to be someone's MILF or cougar, I'm not into threesomes, I'm not polyamorous, I don't want to be your mistress, I'm not looking for a quick lay. It seems that those are most of the desired qualities of men's posts on Craigs.

I am looking for a man who is emotionally available and knows how and when to talk, and who knows how and when to listen. I am looking for someone who doesn't necessarily agree with me on everything, but who can respect that I have my own valid opinions and wants to hear them. I am a giver and a toucher, and I hope to find a man who can handle those qualities and return them in his own authentic way.

If you choose to reply to this post, please be local to the North Bay area, and please don't be offensive or crude - I don't need or want it. Thanks for reading.

55 - 65

title: Once upon a time...
text:
there was a woman who lived in San Francisco and after her "forever" prince turned to brass, she went in search of her Knight in Shining Armor (the real deal, not the stuff that turns green), the one who would sweep her off her feet, be her Renaissance Man, and love, respect, and cherish her for their happily after. 

After trying to spin straw into gold for one of her suitors, she learned he was only interested in the gold and not the special talents and qualities that she possesses. He wanted only the brand new gold, not realizing that gold never tarnishes and failed to realize that this craft took years of patience, skill and maturity to master. She didn't lose heart.

Her next suitor tried to awaken her passions to him with a kiss, not realizing that a woman of her caliber though passionate for the right Knight, wasn't an easy score. He tried to ply her with words of empty affection, promises of great intimacy, telling her things she wanted to hear and not the truth, in order to seduce her into his bed chambers. This didn't work but she kept her hopes high.

Next up was a very young suitor who was enamored with the notion of a cultured, experienced, intelligent woman who could educate and teach him things in the arts of love and though she was not particularly attractive and somewhat full figured which might turn off some, he ardently pursued her so that she could teach him these things. She gently put aside his affections because she knew she wanted a full, mature Knight who knew what he wanted and could care and cherish her. She still believes her Knight in shining armor is out there.

Are you the Knight she has been seeking these past few years to find? The one who eclipses all of her former suitors? If you think chivalry is alive and well, please reply to this posting. Please write as if you were sending a message to your future wife and tell her about why you are the Knight in Shining Armour she has been searching for.

Girl, #3- We've had much fun together both in and out of the bedroom but it's become a friendship since she's committed elsewhere.
Guy, #4- good in bed, but schedules ruin continuity.

Yes, at one point I was involved with these 4 in the same time frame/month or so. And 1/3, 3/4 simultaneously. My only reservations are against unsafe sex (I'm a germaphobe)

So, now that I've put it all out there, I'll move on to what I'm searching for.

Ideally, I want a singular person. One person that I can count on to be my friend, lover, adventure partner, and partner in crime- and one that has the time to be such a thing on a regular basis (1-2xs wk at least) 

Granted, that is a lot to ask for... and probably unrealistic seeing as the only way I was able to achieve somewhat fulfillment of these needs was through various different individuals. But, I'll try for it nonetheless. 

Now that you've seen the inner workings of my happily perverted life, please reply with the following: subject line: "#1", picture, brief description about you, your likes, desires, current situation, and availability.

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, in which city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay. 
** To receive a reply, Please send your Photo and a Descriptive Letter **

title: Smart and Sexy Looking for Guy to make her Laugh 45- 59
text:
There's nothing better than spending time together with a man that's smart, creative, and a bit sexy. And one who enjoys going to farmer's market for fresh produce!

I'm 5'3, - and in shape, as I enjoy working out. I'm stable, sane, employed, and have my own home. I enjoy cultural outings, outdoor activities, and the genuine companionship of someone in a similar life situation whose interests match my own. I'm well read, politically astute, and enjoy a great conversation.

Now for the harder stuff: I'm looking to expand my social life and possibly meet someone special. A friend first that evolves and grows into something more. I think the best couples are friends as well as lovers.

I'm looking for a SWM professional (white collar) guy who is grounded, reliable, and introspective. Someone who is comfortable enough in his own skin to see the humor in life's ups and downs and can laugh at himself. Someone close to my age who lives nearby. I live in Concord (boring, I know!!)

I like to spend time hanging out in the City catching some lunch or checking out an art gallery and then a hike and out for drinks. Maybe swimming out here in the east bay, being lazy in the sun for a bit, and then going to a movie. Or maybe you teach me something totally out of my comfort zone.

I like fast cars and guys who enjoy speed. Not much beats taking a drive with the top down and the music up loud. I like going out dancing and there is something so sensual as being in the arms of a man on the dance floor.

I like people who enjoy taking a risk and going to new places and trying new items on the menu. You never know until you give it a try!

I also enjoy that connection to spirituality, whatever that means for each of us. I believe there is a greater power out there and that gives me a lot of satisfaction and peace. I'm a beginner when it comes to meditation but spending some quiet time going inward helps me deal with life's challenges.

I'm attracted to a confident man - one who is driven by the need to succeed - but who also has another side to him. A funny, silly side. And understands the work/life balance. And, who when teased, can laugh at himself a bit. 

If my posting interests you, please respond back with your information- age, hobbies and background, and a picture.

title: Mutual respect, compatibility and chemistry......
text:
I am still holding out for what I know to be a healthy relationship and will not settle for anything less for the both of us.
My definition of a healthy relationship is compatibility, reliability, honesty, mutual respect and admiration, and lots of chemistry. Chemistry is a must. Without a spark there is no flame and I prefer hot over cold any day.
Not looking to change you and not looking for you to change me. Take me as I am and I will do the same for you. That is if I like you! LOL
I have my serious, mature, responsible side that takes care of business, pays the bills, cooks, cleans, comforts, nurtures, and loves. My not so serious side takes me on adventures in our beautiful state, Kauai, walks on the beach, drives up and down the coast, movies, bowling, shooting pool and shooting the s#$t, evenings with friends, dinner with family, game nights, and so much more than I could put here.
Trying new things, meeting new people, and being open minded to how the world operates and how other people think keeps me excited and motivated to do and be more. Compassion and empathy is how I practice looking at the world. We all need it. Try it it's good for you.
There is so much more to us than we could ever put here so when you respond please tell me at least as much about yourself as I did about myself under "helpful details". It won't kill you. 
Please be white, on the Peninsula, (this means the West Bay) between 50 and 60ish, kind, caring, and an honest soul who is serious about responding.
If you put "Serious" in the subject line I will read your response because I will know you have read my entire post and are serious about pleasing your woman by doing as she asked. All others will be deleted.
Thank you reading and may we all find love today.

title: rainy day woman
text:
Life would be so much easier if we could have anything or anyone we wanted, but it really doesn't work that way, does it? I continue to post because I have faith that sooner or later someone is going to enter this doorway at just the moment he is supposed to, but it feels as though the loneliness that comes between is almost unbearable. 

Which is difficult for others to understand. The loneliness. Mine doesn't come from discord at home, as I read constantly in my inbox. It comes from a place inside, and isn't anything I want to explain to anyone but the right person. The right person will accept who I am and want to spend time with me anyway, even if it isn't everlasting. And let's be honest; affairs never last, do they? They ignite and then they burn out and we move on. 

Someone asked me recently why I didn't choose him, and I tried to explain the kind of connection I need. Then the next day I met someone and asked why he didn't choose me. it's just impossible to put into words, until we find each other. Then sometimes the words come but the rest is magic. 

So, here are some things about me... I'm nothing spectacular to look at. You're going to be attracted to my soul, anyway, if we're the right match. We need to be attracted physically too of course which is why I'm asking for your picture when you respond. I don't need to see your bare chest or your hat or sunglasses, but a face, because a face says a lot. I'm not a go out and party kind of girl, but a quiet sort. We can cross these things off the list; fun in the sun, hiking, biking, massages, and coffee dates. I'm looking for a quiet place to be, away from my chaotic life, in the company of someone I can talk to and just be with. 

You are 45-60ish who isn't hung up about being their age (younger and 'young at heart' need not apply), relatively stable and reasonably mature. Smoking is a deal breaker. I like tall, smart and well put together. I want someone to talk with virtually (by way of text or some kind of app) at first, and in between being together. If you're too busy for that, you won't have time for someone like me. Attentiveness without smothering is key. You're not looking for the love of your life because I already have mine, but you feel that friendship is important. You won't shy away from complexity, you're patient, and you won't try to fix or change me. Acceptance is paramount. I'm not here for a one and done. I want to invest in you without taking away anything which you already have. And you will have some flexibility in your weekday/night schedule. 

I've been told that men don't read all the way to the end. Let's see if that's true. 

So, to recap.. You're older than me, taller than me, willing to share me, communicative, mature. Basically, don't be a dick. I need a little more kindness and a touch of sensitivity around me, and someone I can believe in. You're going to send me a picture, you'll tell me your age so I don't have to pry it out. And you're going to impress me with at least 25 words. They'll come easy to one who holds the magic. 

Well, I'm going to let old Gordo say it best; Rainy day people always seem to know when it's time to call. Rainy day people don't talk, they just listen till they've heard it all. Rainy day lovers don't lie when they tell 'ya they've been down like you. Rainy day lovers don't love any others, that would not be kind. Rainy day people all know how it hangs on a peace of mind. Rainy day lovers don't hide love inside they just pass it on...

After your proper introduction, send me a song too..

title: Brainy BBW
text:
I used to think that, as an overweight woman, all I had to offer was my personality (which is pretty awesome sauce) but it turns out that I am also a sex object. Who knew? Now I can't wait to have a man use me for my brain.

I am probably most men's worst nightmare because I want a serious relationship. I don't need to walk down the aisle in a fluffy white dress, but I would like to get married at some point. I am not interested in having kids of my own, but if you have them, that is fine with me. So, I won't put any pressure on you to do these things NOW, but you have to see a commitment with someone in your future in order to get a response from me. 

I am a professional woman with a demanding career. I am ambitious and I take my work, but not myself, very seriously. I only work 40 hours a week, and I have many hobbies, so I am achieving some kind of work-life balance. I am looking for a partner who wants to make plans with me, but also wants to succeed in work and explore his interests. I will give you space, but it would be nice to know that you miss me sometimes.

If you are a mature and educated man, with a serious relationship in mind, I would love to hear from you. Sense of humor is really important to me, and I tend to be the funnier person in the relationship, but I would love for you to show me up. 

I have posted before but never seem to connect with anyone long-term. Follow through is important. I am a woman of action looking for a man of action.

title: HOW LOW MUST ONE GO?
text:
Good day to you, sweets!


Quick intro ~ 

I am semi new to SF and am hoping to eventually find someone to share life in the city with (LTR). I am searching via CL (and oh my, how creepy and scary it seems sometimes, for both men and women alike) because of discretion, unlike what you find on main stream dating sites. I know a woman like me should NOT be on CL, but, we all have to start somewhere and, hey, when you know what you want and deserve, sometimes it takes a bit longer to find :) Let's cut to what matters...

About me and in no particular order:

I live in SF
30 years old and 100% woman (this is SF, you never know)
I'm 5'8" tall and weigh 128 pounds
Mixed Race
Athletic build- 32DDD bust - 26" waist (size 2/3) - 32" hips
I model but am a rookie 'techie' too 
I can dress with the best as I love fashion but I'm not afraid to get down and dirty
I have tattoos and piercings 
I have a BS in BioChem and practiced clinical pharmacy for seven years
I speak three languages 
I love to travel and learn about culture
I enjoy music, news, and politics
I am an atheist 
Come from a great, healthy, and stable home 
I take pride in being a little different from what I feel/see as being the norm, so I strive to be better
I am domesticated (no, this doesn't mean I pop out babies left and right and stay cooking in the kitchen)
I cook, clean, and am tidy/organized
I am emotionally stable and strong
I listen and speak well
I love unconditionally
I compete with myself to better myself, as I am my only competition, not other women or men.
I am 4/20 friendly however not tobacco or any other 'drug' friendly
Social drinker but no alcoholic 'red-flag' tendencies 
I am honest and real 
I can have an intellectual conversation with both the neighborhood thug and the president (meaning diversity has been perfected). 
I love to learn
I am consistent and committed (no games)
I am laid back and open-minded but can be out-spoken when necessary
I am fun and funny
I love all indoor/outdoor activities
I am active/fit
I enjoy going out as well as staying in
I am disease free....no bugs on/in me! 
I take care of myself... hygiene is a must! I come from the medical field!

My man would be something like....... (and in no particular order):

Age between 35-60
Tall.... preferably a minimum of 6'0 ft. (I'm a tall one)
Clean 
Hygiene keen
Fun with sense of humor 
I don't discriminate on race..... come one, come all!
Wealthy/successful.....so many gold diggers. I'm not. Period. Actions will prove it such and if we meet, I'll explain why
Passionate
Well mannered
Well traveled
Educated
Speaks well....although it's not necessary to be all conservative ALL the time....speak freely. You're with me, not your boss!
Family oriented 
Enjoys kids and/or wants some/more of his own
Experienced in dating. Please, we are grown. You should know what it is you're looking for at this point in life
Solid decision maker and mentally stable.... I'm not a creep. You need not be one either. It's okay to be excited! NOT a creep.
Secure in life and with self
Someone real on the first date (and consistently real thereafter for that matter). You get to meet me, not my representative. Just be you. I like that!
I'm looking for a man who enjoys feeling special too! We all need it. 
A man who appreciates a woman who keeps the house just as clean as her nails and teeth.
I'm looking for a man who would appreciate coming home to a healthy, home-cooked meal hot and ready on the table after a long days work and much more....
Someone who resides in San Francisco only
Someone active physically and enjoys an array of activities, that life and this very city have to offer 

I just cut to the chase. It makes this process much easier. Please respond with something personal in the title of your reply so I know you are real. Please also include a pic. I'm sure you'd like one in return and it's only fair! This is extremely important as I don't want anyone's time wasted on long conversations with absolutely zero physical attraction (which, we as adults know looks aren't everything but they amount to 90% of 'step one' in the dating world). NO pic, NO response. I'm also not into a million and one emails back and forth. Let's chat and connect! No drama. No games. No lies. I am who I say I am. I'd ask for the same in return. I expect the best because that's all I have to give :) 

Happy searching, gentlemen and thank you for the time! xo

title: Strangers are friends waiting to be made
text:
As I sit here and ponder on what I am looking for and what I desire, I had to take time to reflect on those in which I have met on here. 

Over the past 6 months I have learned so much about myself, about dating, about who I am, who I want to be and most important, what I am looking for in a partner. 

In that time, I have loved, I have lost, I have created great memories, but most of all, I have become a stronger, better woman. 

The heartbreak was almost unbearable, but I am not looking at with any regrets. I was a scared, weak, fragile woman when I met the man that changed my life forever. He turned me into this beautiful woman, who is strong, confident, loving, and yes still a little fragile. The stars were all aligned the night we met. Little did I know that the stars would slowly fade, and in time go their separate ways. He as often questioned why he had such an impact on me. My answer to that is: He treated me like a woman, he had respect for me, and he showed me what love was all about. 

Since this man left my life, I have found it to be a struggle to find someone of quality. That is why I question if this is the right place to look. That is when I am reminded of him and all hope comes back, that there will be that one amazing man out there for me. I can't give up and waste this precious heart by not sharing it with the right person. 

With all that being said, let me tell you a little more abut myself: 

I am single, I have a professional career, I also have children, my own place, my own vehicle, and a kindred spirit. I enjoy going for walks in the evenings, long mountains drives to nowhere, outdoor concerts, a glass of wine by the fireplace, a cup of coffee on the patio, camping, watching movies, cuddling and many more things. 

I am looking for someone between 35-50, employed, independent, romantic, fun loving, outgoing, has moral, family values, and not afraid to show emotion. 

So, after reading my short story, if you are interested in getting to know me more, all I can say is that you won't regret it. Even if we don't have a physical attraction, we can have a wonderful friendship. 

I look forward to hearing from you. Have a great weekend.

title: Personally
text:
Do you have a tendency to blurt things out? Were you absent the day they passed out filters? Do you ever reflect on things you've said or done while you were "just kidding" or "just partying"? 
Have you accused someone of creeping or stalking, even as you patrol their work and home, and keep tabs on their social media? You know if you've done this. 
Have you interfered in friend or work relationships just because you knew how? Do you ever discuss your own behavior, or do you focus on what others are doing/not doing? 
Have you insulted others for your entertainment? How do you respond if it happens to you? 
Do you have a wandering eye? Do you comment on sexual aspects of most people? Do you question the loyalty of anyone you're "with" who makes these kinds of comments? Do you try and "catch" those who care about you doing something wrong? Do you do anything wrong (even if you don't admit it)?
Do you have secret emails, secret phone numbers, secret identities, secret "friends", secret hobbies, etc? Do you demand 100% access to all of these things from those you're seeing?
Do you think there's a difference between "just sex" and "cheating"? Do you have the same flexible standards with others? Is a one night stand ok if you're drunk or high? Is it ok if no one knows about it? 
Do you find yourself concocting stories, but expect 100% honesty from others? 
None of this stuff is particularly right or wrong. People do whatever they want. Situational ethics are there, and we use them. You don't build a bond that way. Maybe you don't want a bond. That's ok too. I'll keep my distance. 
I can be quite the introvert, and I like my privacy. Hovering shows lack of trust, whether it's your boss or a friend. 
There will be times I disappear, and that's to your benefit. I'm probably tired or stressed or ready to punch you in the face for your stupid double standards. Leave me alone for awhile. 
I value and need all kinds of things. Intimacy and touch are key. Could be sex. Could be holding hands. Could be your presence during a difficult time. 
I like to check out new places and learn new things. I might go the whole day without talking, or I might never shut up. It depends on the day. I tell stories about people and things that make me laugh. Sometimes I'm sad or emotional about people I miss, or things that have changed. 
I'm not a daredevil. There are things that scare the crap out of me. Bungee jumping and heights tend to make me want to vomit. Do what you need to do. I'll be shaking in my boots until I see you again. I will try not to vomit. 
My son in law went sky diving for his birthday. I was pretty sure he'd lost his damn mind, but it's his to lose. 
I feel no rush about anything these days, and that's pretty nice. Rushing has gotten me in plenty of trouble. 
There's a difference between caring and controlling. Those two get mixed up all the time. I care, and I want you to be ok. And you make your own path. 
I have a ton of loyalty and affection to offer. I'm selective. If you do things to test or hurt me, I'll get over it. But they'll stay on my mind. If the same treatment toward you would cause a blow out, shit storm, WWIII, maybe that's something to consider. Just saying. 
You want to be understood and respected? Don't we all? If you're off the market, own up to it. If you're looking for a side chick, own it. If you have no idea what you're looking for, that's fine too. Maybe you just need an ear. I'm happy to draw lines if I have any idea of where they go.

title: Any special guys out there?
text:
Are there any awesome guys left out there who truly want to settle down and start the next phase of their life with that special someone?

Perhaps you men out there are thinking the same thing about women.:)

I'm mostly attracted to white males. Please be in this age range only 35-40.

Maturity, sensitivity,attentiveness, and a caring nature are what I'm looking for.

It's also important that the person cares about their health.

Major turnoff are selfishness, arrogance, and self centeredness.

I am a nice person, and I expect the person I'm with to encompass all the positive qualities I mentioned. It also helps to have a sense of humor and a willingness to talk things out. I can admit when I'm wrong, and I expect that the other person can do the same. No one is always right, and no one is always wrong.

I'm about 5"5, with light brown hair and blue eyes. I am in descent shape because I do workout. 

I truly am looking to settle down. I hope that whoever reads this is looking for the same thing.

title: Chemistry 101-Fun & Romance w SWM, 55-70 w Integrity/Brains & Kindness
text:
I go out occasionally and have many social activities, but it seems, that, either, I meet people I already know, and most of those people are couples, or I find people to whom I'm not particularly attracted. 

I'm not too surprised that I'm not finding who I'm looking for, as I haven't been looking very hard and sometimes it seems like looking for a needle in a haystack :-) 

In past good relationships, I've usually met my BF doing something I already enjoyed doing; when I wasn't really looking for someone. 
We would meet as friends and eventually grow into lovers. 

The Someone Special I'm seeking is a combination of healthy, smart, upbeat, in his late 50's to 70 years old, enthusiastic about both mental and physical activities, possessed of a witty sense of humor, a sensual kisser, graduate education and who has the emotional framework and free time to welcome getting to know each other. 

He's a SWM, a non-smoker, appreciative of spontaneous absurdity, somehow still unjaded from the trials of love and life, emotionally idealistic enough to seek a meaningful connection with a partner, independent and individualistic enough to keep his own identity, highly portable, perhaps a bit shy but ultimately warm and open, tender-hearted, but still manly, flexible in mind, supple in body, agile in schedule, a lover of words and ideas, explorative as a lover , a true male encouraging feminism, who has a luminous and contagious smiler. 

A "man like you" is someone not unlike me!

While it would be great to suddenly meet someone like you and hit it off immediately, I have my doubts about the Internet as a place to do it. That said, it's worth a try. So drop me a line, and let me know who, what, where - your name, age, in which city you live, height and weight, work, passions.

I am sweet, petite, thin, athletic SWF with grad degrees, can be silly and silent sometimes, always warm sometimes witty, size 4, blue-green eyes and dark curls.

Prefer a SWM, 55-70, who lives/works on the Peninsula/South Bay. 
** To receive a reply, Please send your Photo and a Descriptive Letter **

title: Happy Lady
text:
Hello. Thanks for clicking here.

I am a young at heart 48 year old with tons of friends and family. I seek fun, laughs, and honest times. I was married for 10 years (many years ago, no baggage, no scars!) and have no kids (just never happened, but adore playing Auntie to tons of kids). I grew up in a big Irish Michigan family, then after college lived in DC, NYC, and now the SF Bay Area. I am grateful for my midwest roots and adopted east coast mentality (sweet but direct, NO BS).

My interest are varied. I am open and curious about so many things. Love exploring new local places and exotic travel. Enjoy all artsy things like museums, music, festivals. Plus I truly like sports and attending games more than the average girl. Mostly, I just like to keep busy and am able to end the day with a "Wow. That was a good day!"

What am I looking for? Simply, a good guy! You know, the type who automatically reaches to helps an old person, opens a door, smiles at a stranger. Plus call me old fashion, but I like traditional dating. So if you like my ad, write back, let's exchange photos and a few brief emails, and then ask me out if you are interested. 

I went to a super fun party last night and was told too many times "Why don't you have a boyfriend???" So today, I am trying to answer that question. I hope to hear from someone special. For some reason, it's been a long time since I dated someone seriously but I am open to meeting a great guy who has some time for a fun, good gal. Let's enjoy Spring (and beyond) together.

-Molly

title: CL is full of surprises...
text:
It's a lazy Sunday and I'm not feeling the best so I decided to kill some time browsing CL. I have to confess, I was a bit surprised, but in a good way. Found a post from a man that specifically stated he had all his teeth, which made me laugh. I mean, that's a great quality to have - is that rare on CL? Saw another ad posted by a man looking for a woman who loves cunnilingus - understandable. I would be very surprised if he was not inundated with responses. 

I wonder how many people actually meet through this site. I've tried online dating without much success, unfortunately. Sometimes it seems like online dating makes it harder to meet someone because you are sorting through countless profiles to find that perfect one who may or may not exist. 

I hope that the people who have posted do find the responses they are looking for. I miss that human interaction too - when you first meet someone you have chemistry with. The butterflies, the kissing, the excitement and hopefulness...I don't really know why I am making this post; it was just nice to see real posts from real people.

title: ISO guy friend, possibly more
text:
I'm a 36yo Filipina with too much free time on her hands. Well, aside from my job, and being caretaker for my dad.

I'm looking for someone to chat with, get to know, share a few interests with; if things click between us it may turn into something more; I'm open to the idea. If not, at least we've become friends. 

I have been told I'm upbeat, hilarious, kind and loyal. I'm a bit reserved at other times, probably because I like to stay neutral. As in I always like to see and understand both sides of the issues at hand. 

I look pretty average, although my ex swears that I look cute, especially around the eyes. I dress tomboyish (because it's comfortable), but can clean up nice depending on the occasion.

I like watching anime, Asian dramas, and comedies. My tastes in music are all over the place, though my current favorites are Kpop and 90s R&B. I do appreciate jazz, since I've played saxophone as a teen. I'm a bit of a foodie, so I like checking out different cuisines/restaurants as well as trying out different recipes. Yes, I can cook. I am a trained artist (and have the BFA to prove it).

So I guess this is the part where I mention what I want in a guy friend. The ideal one would be either Asian or white, hwp, fairly good looking, under 40, share some of the same interests, and at least have their act together. They would also be kind, caring, considerate, positive, and loyal. Most importantly, they don't play games; the last time I posted this the guy who responded decided to see someone else while leading me on. Not cool.

So if you're interested please email me, and we'll see where this goes. Your pic gets mine. And to prove you're real and not a bot, put your favorite fruit in the subject line. (Mine's lychee.)

Thanks for looking. :)

title: Seeking bi guy for LTR
text:
Hello! I am looking to find a bi guy (40-52) to date and see how we click for a long term relationship. (If you are not bi that's ok .. I'm just seeing who's out there.) I am quite open-minded and would need you to be too, as I use a wheelchair. I am very caring, educated, self-sufficient (work), drive, very sensual, petite, youthful, quiet/reserved with a sometimes goofy and sometimes wild side, love animals, and love to laugh. I like being around goal-oriented people. I long for a relationship based on mutual respect, and lots of fun including weekend getaways. I spent most of my life in SoCal and have been in NorCal past 10 years. I currently live a couple hours northeast of Vallejo but love to drive (and can work from anywhere via phone/internet). I am open to moving for the right guy (unless he wants to move to where I am). If interested, let's talk and exchange pics and see how we mesh. I look forward to hearing from you!

Guys have asked me "why bi?" I just think it's hot watching two guys together. It's not something I want on a daily basis, but now and then would be fun. And again, you don't have to be bi. I just thought it'd be fun to see what the possibilities are. And no, I'm not really bi myself.

In your reply, please save us both time and tell me about you including your age and interests (other than sex). Just to be clear, I am not on here for casual; I am seeking a new partner. Thanks!

title: Searching for a heart of gold
text:
I want to live, I want to give.
I've been a miner for a heart of gold.
It's these expressions I never give
That keep me searching for a heart of gold,
And I'm getting old.

Neil Young's words capture how I feel about finding a man who -- like me -- has a heart of gold.

If you're the one I seek, you're a kind, compassionate, caring gentleman between the ages of 60 and 75 who lives close enough to me so we can play together frequently. I'm hoping you share these qualities that describe me: educated, intelligent, and articulate; energetic and engaged; a non-smoker (of tobacco) but appreciator of wine, spirits, and the herb (all in moderation); financially stable and socially progressive.

Physically, I am of average height and weight (5'4"/~138 lbs.), and considered pretty/attractive...but attraction is personal. While I appreciate lifestyle differences, I'm best matched with a man who -- like me -- is Caucasian, monogamous, and omnivorous. I am interested only in men who are legally and emotionally available -- i.e., single, divorced, or widowed, and not currently partnered.

If you would like to start a conversation, I hope you'll reply to tell me about yourself and why you think we might be a good match. Be sure to include your age and location, and attach a photo. I am happy to reciprocate if we seem well matched.

title: Dating LTR/Romance Needed
text:
I have really bad scars from an accident I had as a child. **The photo is a picture of an ex model turned burnsurvivor named Turia Pitt. ** I read about her story and how her relationship was able to pull through the trauma of her accident. Although it's a bit of a reach for me, I am hopeful that despite the absence of the right guy, its possible for me too. 

So coupled with the outcome of my injury and growing up in a conservative household, I consider myself a bit of a late bloomer. The scars on my face are my biggest regret because as you can imagine people's stares aren't always kind. So in anticipation of eye contact, I tend to look away. Trust me, I'm working on it and it's getting better with time. 

My personality is adaptable. In many instances like work and school, I'm a social butterfly and a relatively confident person. But when it comes to social environments where I'm meeting people who aren't familiar with me and especially where dating or flirting happens, I tend to flounder and not know what to do... While this seems like a venting session, I'd like to hope there's someone who's out there who can relate and or want to get to know me, despite the obvious challenges I'm getting over.

I have made some strides in the dating area, I guess. The other day I met someone I was chatting with from tinder and it went fine. We met once after a few days and then another time after a few weeks of talking. I just don't think it's going anywhere because subtle things indicated that he didn't respect me or my time... I'll leave it at that. But for some reason a few days after the second meet up we just stopped checking in. Despite that upset, I did learn through that experience that in spite of feeling singled out and unlovable; I realized how many, if not all people sometimes feel that way. 

Simply put by a bar buddy I met at the Continental Dinner while waiting forty-five minutes for my date to arrive (oops, I said I wouldn't get into that), the buddy said we all have scars and experience trauma. Its just that some of your scars show on the outside. As simple and obvious as that may seem, it meant the world to me to feel that even for a second, I wasn't as different as my appearance and interactions lead me to sometimes feel and believe. Needless to say, I'm working on myself but am certainly not a push over (so you preying wolf, stay away!) 

If you're interested in getting to know someone like myself and maybe hangout, shoot me a message by telling me about yourself and attach a picture of yourself. Here's some of the things I hope you're like:

Friendly, Respectful
Single, No kids, Never married
Educated, Employed, Ambitious
27-35 age **
5'9 height or taller *
Stylish/Well groomed

More About Me----> I'll send you my picture once you send yours. I'm an African American educated female, 5'10, slim build, dark toned skin, and I have a great smile. I know it may seem like I'm asking for a lot but hey why limit your hearts desire. Prayers up. :) Thats it for now...

title: Looking for my partner in crime
text: Hi there, round 2 posting this because I'm still trying to find somebody fun! I'm just wondering where all the decent non-whacko guys have gone?? I mean, I know this is Craigslist and all, but I seriously am wondering if there are still some chivalrous, kind, and genuine guys out there. I'm really not going to write out a huge list of please have and please have nots like some of the ads on here have. That's great if you're looking for your soulmate, by tomorrow lol, but not for just finding awesome people to hang out with and see where it goes. I'm a fairly laid back California native, and I'm just looking for someone to hang out with that won't be a super stalker or wants to pick out a wedding venue on the 3rd date. I mean, that's like a 6th date conversation, maybe 7th, lol. So kidding ;-) I refuse to believe chivalry is dead and I'm sure there has to be a guy out there who wants to join me on activities similar to these: random adventures into SF, day trips to the beach or lakes/river etc, drinking a little too much wine and watching a funny movie, or just hanging out at home cooking up something amazing for dinner. Good cuddlers and amazing huggers are encouraged to apply :-) I'm the anti-chick in that I'm not looking for something super serious from the first email exchange we will have. I just want to connect with someone and find someone who enjoys my company as much as I enjoy theirs. All I ask is that you are: not a tobacco smoker, not married or otherwise romantically involved, gainfully employed, not looking for a hookup, somewhat around my age (around 24-38 but not super picky about it), taller than me is preferable, not more than 30 min away from Walnut Creek, and real. Please include a pic and change the subject to "Partner in Crime" to weed out spam. Please only email if you are really interested in getting to know me and hanging out. Anyways, thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you soon!

title: Ready For Love?
text:
Loving is easy. It is being loved that is the great challenge - allowing that feeling coming from someone elses entire body to get beneath your skin and penetrate down to your bone marrow where you can be known and you can be changed. A challenge you cannot meet or even imagine unobserved and by yourself.

THE HUNGER

I knocked at your door
but you were at the window, looking up the road waiting for your true love to appear.
I stood beneath your window and sang the sweetest serenade
but you were in the garden, battling the bees for the most beautiful flower to offer her when she arrived.
I picked the lock on your garden gate
but you were in the kitchen bullying the cook into preparing the most perfect amorous feast.
When you died it was said that you choked on the bone of a lark
dining alone.

Are you ready?

title: Sensitive / Caring 49 year old female looking for an honest/caring man
text:
Originally from New York, I have been living in California since 1998. I do keep myself busy with my own career (I can sometimes work from home) but also have time and will make an effort for the right man who makes time for me. I am seeking a Caucasian man who is between the ages of 48 - 58.

I am not really a world traveler and like being close to home, but will travel a little. I guess you would call me more of a homebody. I do, however, love to learn about new places, people and cultures.

I'm the mother of two grown daughters who are off at college. I am divorced. I'm very down to earth, I think, easy to get along with. I listen more than I talk. ¬†I like to read a lot and keep up with many things--politics, social issues, culture, travels, people. I am also an animal lover, especially dogs. I really hate disrespectful people. 

I especially value humor, being able to laugh at yourself, being able to communicate, (VERY IMPORTANT). If you are the type of man who I have to guess what is on your mind, please move on. I am much too old and mature to play any type of head games and you also must know what you want.

I also like Alfred Hitchcock, psychological thrillers (not the gory, hack'em, slash'em films), , hearing people's stories, and simply talking with someone who really wants to know me and does not judge. I'm looking for a companion--someone with his own life, I do not get along with strong personalities, so please be easygoing, gentle and kind towards animals, people. You are the type of man who would hold a door open for a stranger or help a stranger out if you see them with a flat tire on the side of the road. You are able to make the compromises that life sometimes requires. Someone who isn't too thin, is comfortable with their own body (You do not have to be a male model type), and who is able to laugh at himself. No smokers, please. No drugs, please. A man who does not live in the gym. No pictures will be swapped as I must get to know the inside of you, rather than the outside first. I DO understand there must be a physical attraction, but that comes later, (sorry if you don't agree, we will not get along). I am NOT looking for a purely physical encounter. There must be a emotional connection or a strong enough connection for me to share my pics over the internet.

You must be open and be able to talk about anything., good and bad. With so many people in the world today, and especially the scammers on Craigslist, I am truly hoping that I find someone for me, willing to take the time, but not rush things and I am also willing to open my heart again ( I have done this before and got hurt). I truly believe in love and that there is truly someone out there for everyone. You just have to have the bravery to find YOUR someone that truly makes you a better person. You must believe that if there is such a person in your life and you have that connection, etc., you are not afraid to take the next step and eventually get married. No serial daters, please. 

Let me get this straight too, I am NOT looking for a husband right away, it takes time to get to know one another, but looking for a true soulmate, someone who really wants to be with me, gets me and really want the emotional, the physical (eventually) and not be afraid to let go of old baggage and move on with your life. Even though, I have grown children, men who have children do not scare me. Thanks for reading and I hope someone out there will take this as serious as I do, but with a hint of humor too.

title: Love nature? Joyful? Affectionate? Funny? Care about the world? Great!
text:
A Bit About Me

A desert wildflower has stopped me in my tracks. So has anything that makes me laugh, a grizzly bear in Alaska, a perfect vocal harmony, a stunning panel of petroglyphs in Utah, a flock of thousands of snow geese in the air at dawn, a snappily written paragraph, a grove of redwoods, and the wonderful company of good friends. I'm passionate about life and eager to learn from it. I want to be passionate about you, too, as my partner for the rest of our days.

I'm a professional do-gooder, involved in environmental and science education and sustainability. Previously I taught kids outdoors as a park ranger and naturalist (no, not a naturist until I get to know you better) and these days I'm a nonprofit environmental fundraiser. I also am active in issues of equality around race, gender and economic status. I volunteer as a peer counselor on a hotline. While I take helping others and bettering the world seriously, I'm also a goofball known to dance in the living room.

I'm big-hearted and small-bodied. I wear my heart on my sleeve but not make-up. Words and writing captivate me--obviously, since I do go on and on here. I'm a lifelong learner and enjoy reading about multiple subjects. I thrive on touch and affection. I love being silly and playful, and laugh easily and frequently. I buy organic and local whenever possible. I appreciate movies but don't watch television. Hiking, camping and backpacking make me happy. Smoking and recreational drugs don't, and I don't want either in my life. I enjoy pets but alas, I am allergic to dogs and birds. Cats are manageable. I'm a big fan of wild birds, though, and love birdwatching.

I enjoy and am inspired by the company of people who appreciate creative expression in whatever form that may take--music, writing, photography, painting, design, etc., even if it's as an enthusiast and you don't do any of these things yourself. I'm a singer and mountain dulcimer player, and a beginner on the banjo.

I'm Jewish by birth and culture but not religion. My Buddhist practice incorporates kindness, mindfulness and bettering the world. Buddhism has no creation story or deity and that appeals to me. What you choose is up to you, including atheism.

I live my life with respect, honesty, and an open heart. I thrive on intimacy. I'm romantic and giving, and it gives me joy to be attentive and appreciative of my partner. I value and consciously engage in being a good communicator and being a good listener, and feel compassion for others. I attend to my physical and emotional health. I have an active inner life and I've been described as an introvert who's learned to be an extrovert.

I'm bisexual and seeking a mutually monogamous relationship with a man, just the two of us. There are a lot of myths about bisexuals, so thanks for ignoring the stereotypes and getting to know me instead.

What I'd Thank My Lucky Stars to Find

Timothy Leary said intelligence is an aphrodisiac. I agree. I don't care about what stuff you own--I want to know what makes your mind light up and your heart sing. I'm seeking a man who is as loving and joyful as I am and expresses that easily, values emotional and physical health, views us as equals, and prioritizes time for our relationship that I hope will last the rest of our lives.

You are single, and live with integrity and humor. Social justice matters to you so you make personal choices to help make the world a better place, in whatever ways move you. You appreciate human diversity and would date someone of any race. When you're outdoors, you appreciate the small wonders of nature along the path and enjoy learning about them. Sleeping in a tent makes you happy.

I'm not looking for a clone of myself. For instance, I don't drink alcohol, but feel free to enjoy it if you're a social drinker as many of my friends are. Our differences are interesting, although if your politics are conservative that wouldn't work.

If you make me laugh, have left-leaning politics, enjoy frequent physical affection, like words and love nature, I might just fall at your feet. I'll even happily share my field guides about birds and flowers so we can geek out on that stuff together. I'm looking for a committed, lifelong partner to come home to. I recognize it will take some time for us to know that about each other. That journey of mutual discovery sounds fabulous to me.

Connecting

If you've read this far, thanks for that. Your thoughtful reply is appreciated, more than a couple of sentences so I can get a sense of who you are and why this ad got your attention. Please include your age and photos with your clothes on. (You can find photos of me online by searching for "woodswoman writes joshua tree."). We wouldn't be a fit if you're deeply rooted in the East Bay or South Bay, with too much concrete and traffic for me in both places.

I confess I have no clue how to do traditional dates in cafes. So let's skip that part by getting to know each other on a hike. Not an audition or interrogation. If we enjoy ourselves, we can get together again.

Intrigued? Do tell.

title: ISO FWB/Partner in crime/complete package

I'm writing this on a whim, so I might miss some things. But it's something I've been contemplating for some time now.

Guy, #1- great in bed, but unavailable otherwise.
Guy, #2- Loves to travel and we go on fun adventures regularly, but we clash fundamentally/he lacks otherwise.
Girl, #3- We've had much fun together both in and out of the bedroom but it's become a friendship since she's committed elsewhere.
Guy, #4- good in bed, but schedules ruin continuity.

Yes, at one point I was involved with these 4 in the same time frame/month or so. And 1/3, 3/4 simultaneously. But, it was more so to try to fulfill my needs rather than pure promiscuity, though I have nothing against that. I'm open minded and respectful of people's preferences. My only reservations are against unsafe sex (I'm a germaphobe)

So, now that I've put it all out there, I'll move on to what I'm searching for.

Ideally, I want a singular person. One person that I can count on to be my friend, lover, adventure partner, and partner in crime- and one that has the time to be such a thing on a regular basis (1-2xs wk at least)

International travel is a great passion of mine and I'd love to share these experiences with my beloved at my side. Local adventuring is also great and I love to explore, hike and be out in nature doing just about anything. Playing in the city is fun, too. 

Fitness and health are important to me, but I am fanatical about neither of them. These days, I prefer oxytocin highs to adrenaline rushes. 

I enjoy writing, reading, dancing, concerts, theatre, films and cultural events of all kinds, along with sharing simple, tender quiet times at home together. Music, poetry and creative expression are deep sustenance in my life. I have no interest in spectator sports, nascar, any organized religion or television. 

I enjoy spirited discussions but I'm not interested in righteous debate. I lean far to the left politically and have little interest in conspiracy theorists. My spiritual life is important to me, but I steer clear of dogma. 

Sexuality is central in a relationship, but I am completely uninterested in casual sex. Let me say that again in case it gets missed: I am not the least bit interested in casual sex. Intimacy takes time to develop and I want to take that time.

I'm far from perfect and so are you; but we are perfectly ourselves and that is enough.

The world of online dating is confounding. I've had a few fun forays and a few more frustrating fumbles. I've been confused by experiences with men who seem interested, but then suddenly disappear without a word or a trace; and I've heard the same from some of them about women. I wonder about how those exchanges affect us as we pursue relationship. It seems like we don't quite know how to gracefully navigate these waters; and yet many of us are looking for similar things: a like-minded and spirited person with whom we can grow and laugh and share and walk through life. 

That's what I'm looking for . . . how about you? 

I recognize that the one-dimensionality of words and photos on computer screens is limited at best. I see this venue as simply one tool, a first step to possibly meet someone who shares common interests and values. Endless emails and titillating talk are not my thing. Let's get real, leave the virtual world behind and find out whether something worth sharing is possible between us.

If you're moved to write back, please share a little something of substance about you. 

All the best to you in finding what your heart desires!

title: Me + You = Us
text:
I am seeking a man who wants to co-create a joyful and conscious relationship that celebrates life and facilitates growth, both as individuals and partners. 

About ME: 
- chronologically newly septuagenarian, but I look and feel 50-ish
- height 5'4", weight 130s (HWP), pretty face 
- raised east-coast Jewish; now spiritually liberal / inclusive / progressive 
- enjoy wine, spirits, and the herb (all in moderation); intolerant of tobacco 
- own my home on the mid-peninsula 

About YOU: 
- age appropriate (~60-75) 
- somewhat taller and bigger than me, but still height-weight proportionate (HWP)
- geographically proximate (the closer the better....)

About US both: 
- legally and emotionally available (i.e., single/divorced/widowed and not currently partnered)
- seeking a best friend, lover, and partner...for the long term 
- educated / intelligent / articulate
- reasonably fit and in good health (no tobacco) 
- financially solvent / responsible
- active / lively / interested
- liberal / progressive -- socially, politically, spiritually 
- values-based, ethical lifestyle 
- kind, gentle, warm, affectionate, considerate, dependable

Although I appreciate and applaud ethnic and lifestyle diversity, I am looking to partner with someone who -- like me -- is Caucasian, heterosexual, and monogamous.

If you resonate with this post, please write to tell me about yourself, including age, location, and current photo(s). I will happily respond in kind if we seem to be a match.

title: For your consideration...

We are not our bodies - - bodies are merely vessels that carry the essence of who we are.
We are not our cars, not our jobs, not our property but we tend to identify ourselves
by our stuff.

If you can relate to this type of thinking, we might have some good conversations.

title: What do I know
text:
I feel lost; not sure if what I want is even realistic. If I don't keep hoping & looking, does that mean I'm settling? I have tried dating a little bit, but either ppl aren't looking for commitment or there's no lust. Sometimes I stay home on a Sat and question why I'm not on a date. I am reluctant to date bc you keep trying and just don't want to be disappointed anymore. I go on these online dating sites, but how do I decide who I should invest. I think I lost the desire & the ability to go out there and date again. I even went as far as moving and thinking that the stars will align and he will show up. Another Epic fail. It feels lonelier more than ever now. 

Meeting ppl at bars, what are the chances that I will meet a good one. meet up events do they even work? I don't believe in work place relationships. Ppl I know are already married and with kids. Has this boat sailed? I rejected 3 ppl in the past, were those decisions mistakes? Live and learn, but decisions have consequences, and on facebk everyone is married with kids. 

I don't want a one night stand. I'm too old for that now. Sex is bland with out passion and connection. 

I want to feel nervous and have butterfly feeling when on a date with someone I really like and he really likes me back. Someone who is not reluctant to commitment if there's a special connection. He must want a family. 

I'm not super pretty, but I'm not ugly either. Yeah I'm short, but I'm a female so that's ok. I'm educated and make a good living. I don't think I sux in bed. So why am I the only one that's not spoken for? 

Looking for a special, lasting connection. Someone worth the time & effort. We're not getting any younger, let's get it together now. I'm educated, financially stable, and have a good profession. Additionally, I'm also family-oriented. I look for the same in a man. 

Me: Viet, 5'0, healthcare.

I'm open to ppl who wanna provide me positive or insightful feedback and perspective. You don't have to rude about it. 

However, if you're interested in dating: the following are my preference...
33-38, educated, employed, not interested in Indians

title: Love Is In the Air (or is that pollen?)
text:
Hello and thank you for reading my CL post.

I'm an attractive, petite, fun, fit , funny (you'll just have to trust me on this) Jewish, East Coast, auburn-haired, blue-eyed, sultry-voiced woman looking for someone with whom to enjoy many of the following (in no particular order):
Hiking, biking and skiing (extra points if you ski or 'board)
Theater
Foreign and independent films
Travel
Road trips in search of the best diner
Getting lost for hours in a book store
Live music (blues are my favorite)
Comedy shows
Great food, interesting cocktails
Scintillating conversation
Unabashed silliness
---And lots of fun!

I'm a social drinker, 420-friendly, easy going, low drama and truly don't sweat the small stuff. Life experiences have taught me that unless someone is dead or dying, all other things can be worked out.

I'm a bit of a news junkie and a dyed-in-the-wool liberal. (I'm campaigning for Bernie Sanders.) 
I get my news from the NY Times, Amy Goodman and Bill Maher. I believe that Bill Moyers deserves rock star status. 

I love to cook and I love to read. Ergo -- I read a lot of cookbooks. This is quite different from watching a lot of cooking shows. (Anecdotal evidence informs me that people who watch cooking shows don't cook -- they're too busy watching cooking shows.)

After a long sales career, I recently transitioned to a fundraising role for a wonderful East Bay nonprofit. It feels great to work with like-minded people toward a common humanitarian goal.

So, what am I looking for? A man who is physically fit, emotionally evolved, knows himself well, has learned from past relationships, has a good sense of humor, likes to laugh, and doesn't take himself too seriously. As important, he knows how to have a mature, honest, loving and monogamous relationship and is a gentleman -- in word and deed. 

Also, at least three people have to think you're funny (and one of them can't be your mother).

I'm a happy person looking for someone to share the happiness and the journey. If we have things in common, you're looking for a unique woman and a great relationship, and what I've written resonates with you, I look forward to hearing from you.

Serious replies only, i.e., you're really looking for a relationship and not because your well-meaning mother and married friends think you should be in a relationship, or you think you want to be in a relationship but you're just not sure, etc., etc., Please, save us both the time and trouble and don't reply if you're ambivalent.

I like fast cars and guys who enjoy speed. Not much beats taking a drive with the top down and the music up loud. I like going out dancing and there is something so sensual as being in the arms of a man on the dance floor.

I like people who enjoy taking a risk and going to new places and trying new items on the menu. You never know until you give it a try!

I also enjoy that connection to spirituality, whatever that means for each of us. I believe there is a greater power out there and that gives me a lot of satisfaction and peace. I'm a beginner when it comes to meditation but spending some quiet time going inward helps me deal with life's challenges.

I'm attracted to a confident man - one who is driven by the need to succeed - but who also has another side to him. A funny, silly side. And understands the work/life balance. And, who when teased, can laugh at himself a bit.
