title: Academics/Writers?
text:
I do not self-identify as an academic, but am a university student who is thinking of writing a dissertation shortly down the road, but I am not sure. As of now, I have some lengthy thesis writing experience and in general have contributed some substantial research and written work in U.S. History, (but I have since been branching out of history, although I may pursue some graduate work this quarter in Subaltern Studies.) My strengths are close reading, archival historical research, finding and explicating sources, and my writing is very detailed and hyper-analytical. At worst, my writing is plagued by excess detail, wordy prose, not so constructive revising/editing practices, nauseating repetition, disorganization, losing sight of the argument I started with, as well as an over-explication of sources and overstated reminders. I am also in the habit of procrastinating or simply dwelling too long on one area and consequently turning in work late, sometimes with typographical errors and really, I am such a hyper-critical perfectionist that I will cringe and brood over any errors I find in a submitted draft. It would be nice to find someone who has either written a dissertation, and/or someone whose strong suit is academic mentoring and editing, someone who has a good (better) work ethic for academic projects, and/or someone who is some kind of aspiring or professional writer. I also enjoy creative writing pursuits very much and thought it would be interesting to meet an aspiring or established novelist, screenwriter, or comedy writer. I am keen on anything from the comic in Aristophanes to Chris Rock. 

I think it is a good rule and ethical to be upfront so I thought I would state I am dealing with chronic depression and tend to have a cynical attitude about life. I am also currently nursing a somewhat wounded heart and have some tremendous self-esteem issues. (Other than that, as if that preface did not seem undesirable enough, I am hyper-sensitive and in some respects maladaptive in interpersonal communications and feel overwhelmed and slighted easily in social situations and dwell excessively over perceived slights.) Needless to overstate, I am in a delicate place. Due to this, I am not an ideal candidate for dating at the moment and would like to endeavor to strictly enforce that boundary for the sake of my mental health and well-being and yours. What I do hope to find and cultivate however is an intensely intellectual comaraderie with a like-minded person, and to feel inspired. Perhaps we could collaborate on writing and research if our disciplines or interests overlap. Collaboration is key -- I already have previous experience working underneath someone and being micro-managed and talked down to by a thesis adviser, so I would like to avoid that kind of treatment.

Cultivating a safe shared spare to vent about our respective psychological and life distress would be ideal also, but I might waive that criteria if I think I am being too self-absorbed or over-sharing; I am already (not prematurely) concluding that the ideal person to confide in is a counselor/clinician, but I feel reluctant as their condescension and authority can feel abrasive. Then again, anyone, myself included (even when I endeavor to be empathetic in the most down to earth way and even when I try my best to not lose sight of the condescension I have been treated to), can come off condescending and abrasive. That said, I am not saying I think it would hurt to try to foster a therapeutic friendship outside of academic collaboration based on venting our respective mental distresses; I am saying I would certainly closely monitor it and make sure it doesn't get too intense and unhealthy.

I thought I would end this ad by listing some academic and other interests: journalism (though I have had some irritating experiences writing for a journalist), social welfare studies, sociology (an intersectional perspective that accounts for race, class, sexuality and other social stigma), doing archival/historical research, rhetoric/argumentation, social activist efforts, ethnic and gender studies, African diaspora studies, history (early to present U.S., medieval to modern Europe, South Asia and the Middle East, the ancient Near East, etc.,) political science (early to present party ideology and party politics, voter habits, race and gender in party politics), critiquing ideologues and pop culture, film studies, comparative literature (deconstruction, literary theory, semiotics, the activity of interpretation/comparing interpretation methods, the rhetoric of humor/humor theories, assessing which and why what literary interpretations are more optimal than others, comparing Enlightenment era thinkers, etc.), philosophy (Kant, Wittgenstein, Frege, Burge, Rorty, Critchley, among others, though I do not have a command over any of them and admittedly get frustrated reading them); movie nights, long introspective discussions, exchanging dark secrets, late night eats at a diner, nostalgia, wallowing while listening to melancholy music (Joni Mitchell, Bob Dylan, The Smiths, Elliott Smith, Radiohead, Chopin, Eric Satie), Oscar Wilde's command for epigram and insights, Allen Ginsberg's endearing bitterness, the detailed introspective writing of Virginia Woolf and Marcel Proust, getting pumped up like a dork listening to the "Gonna Fly Now" theme from the "Rocky" series, getting lost in overly idealistic, elaborative romantic fantasies that I quickly debase with cold cynicism and borderline misanthropy; horror movies done well, non-condescending high-fives, cleaning, good tacos, film projectors, someone with a detailed command and taste for literary and film criticism (an area I do not have a prowess for, though I really do not have a prowess for anything it seems except wallowing in morbid depression), people who consistently inspire me to carry on so that I can become strong enough to consistently inspire the same in others, people who like going on long drives as the driver, people who revel in non sequiturs and who have a strong stomach for morbid divulgences, someone who wants to walk with you through the hell you're in and who won't complain about the encumbering heat, etc.

Please tell me your age, your academic/professional field, your creative pursuits, your hobbies/interests, what area you live in, what you hope to get out of this connection, etc.

title: Spring has Sprung
text:
Signs of spring are everywhere. Driving yesterday and feeling the warm air and the sunshine, it just got to my heart.

Another spring with no one to kiss, no one to share coffee with, no one to invite home to dinner, no one real and sincere. Not much I can do about it.

I am looking for a good real and honest coffee date, with possibilities. It all has to begin somewhere. I've done countless coffee dates and only a handful have turned out to be great friends of mine, lovers or loved ones that turned into real relationships. In the past 10 years ago I would be automatically invited to a nice lunch or dinner because men then were not afraid to get involved. Not one except a really poor guy, asked for me to pay for us. And I did. These days I seem to attract the guys with the empty paper cup that try to get freebies from Starbucks, and that's not cool with me. If you can't afford to buy yourself and/or me a cup of coffee, please don't meet me. I don't want to meet you. It tells me a lot about a man who is down and out, but a man should be able to come up with coffee money if he does the inviting, true?

Anyway spring is around the corner and the days are long. I wish to meet someone who is single or divorced, from the San Francisco Bay Area, not married, not a heavy smoker or heavy drinker (I don't drink). Not someone into alternative lifestyles, just a regular joe. Not someone who is bald because I have a great fear of bald men, something from my past and stuck in my mind.

I have my own problems and deficiencies. I am not skinny, I have some minor health issues, I am NOT an athletic woman, so I don't hike, kayak or climb mountains.
My ideal date is coffee and talking, a bit of walking. Lunch, talk and sharing the sunshine and that lunch could lead to another meet if we like each other.

I am not asking for much here, so please don't crucify me, that happened a few days ago.

Please only write if you are open to meet an educated, honest and thoughtful woman with gray/blonde hair, brown eyes, short and some weight on her.
Insults are not welcome and will just be deleted.

Thanks!

title: Searching for a heart of gold
text:
I want to live, I want to give.
I've been a miner for a heart of gold.
It's these expressions I never give
That keep me searching for a heart of gold,
And I'm getting old.

Neil Young's words capture how I feel about finding a man who -- like me -- has a heart of gold.

If you're the one I seek, you're a kind, compassionate, caring gentleman between the ages of 60 and 75 who lives close enough to me so we can play together frequently. I'm hoping you share these qualities that describe me: educated, intelligent, and articulate; energetic and engaged; a non-smoker (of tobacco) but appreciator of wine, spirits, and the herb (all in moderation); financially stable and socially progressive.

Physically, I am of average height and weight (5'4"/~138 lbs.), and considered pretty/attractive...but attraction is personal. While I appreciate lifestyle differences, I'm best matched with a man who -- like me -- is Caucasian, monogamous, and omnivorous. I am interested only in men who are legally and emotionally available -- i.e., single, divorced, or widowed, and not currently partnered.

If you would like to start a conversation, I hope you'll reply to tell me about yourself and why you think we might be a good match. Be sure to include your age and location, and attach a photo. I am happy to reciprocate if we seem well matched.

title: Uncommon Chef
text:
In my late 40s I finally found the courage to leave my job as a graphic designer and pursue my passion for food. It was part of a long maturing process that also involved creating a healthy distance between myself and my emotionally crippled family. My interest in nutrition soon led to an excitement about cooking and eventually to my becoming a health-oriented personal chef. My individuation from my family and their white-bread-and-mayonnaise values has led to the discovery of myself as a person who is willing to feel deeply, act boldly and think creatively. I want to be with a man who has also become his own person, who considers life an adventure and who has time for romance, intimacy and me.

In my work I help others cook better, host cooking/dinner parties, and cater dinner parties. I'm interested in exploring the science as well as practicing the art of cooking. It would be be great to be with someone who enjoys food and who likes to be the kitchen but I'm capable of being drawn into your world as well if you truly love what you do.

A good match for me is someone who . . ..

...wants to make a difference (big or small scale).
. . .is happy to take the scenic route to just about anywhere
. . .is charmed by down-in-the valley views just as much as bird's-eye vistas.
. . .wants to explore the world --cultures and history-- through food and people, cities and the countryside
....likes to be active, has all-day energy.


Religion has no appeal to me - but I'm definitely intrigued with "spirituality" (am using this for a lack of a better word). Meaning to say, I'm interested in understanding that what's there but cannot be seen.

Community involvement is important to me, I'm active with the South Bay sustainable food movement. Will soon start a two-year term as president of a nonprofit.

Friends? Family? Kids? I have several very close friends, and consider them my family. I raised 4 step children with ex husband in the 90s/early 00s.

Still have my full-suspension mtn bike, panniers, snorkel, backpack, sleeping bag, downhill ski equipment, X-country ski boots, snowshoes. ...and want to do all these activities with a partner,

Eventually, I want to golf, have really enjoyed it the couple of times I've played. And I want to play the piano again, and ride a horse again. I would love to be a good singer and hope to someday take lessons, bonus if I find someone who likes to sing (together). And I love to dance ... the waltz, tango, swing. I'm not one who needs perfection, just enjoyment in a shared activity.

Love yoga, hiking, once or twice a week. I run, occasionally. I like to bike and hope you are ok with me --a slow poke-- some distance behind you. I actually like to fish (shore or boat --jigging, casting, slabbing), I don't have the gear or make a point of going, but will definitely join my partner.

I thoroughly enjoy concerts and live theater; not much of a fan of opera or spectator sports.

I'm exploring and expanding my emotional range with those who are close to me.. It feels like the key to getting the most out of life.

Christian 
Ltr

I find myself to be a bit nerdy, love science, history, museums, art, current events, world news, etc.
I really love men who are intelligent and have many interests. Very passionate about women's rights, socialism, environmental issues, political, animals, etc.

Looks are not what I am after, I seek a man who is worldly and can engage in conversation, just be a little cute.

Non smoker, rare drinker, 31-51, latin, white, Indian or middle eastern, white collar, preppie, average weight.

Kind, sweet, spirtual, seeking love maybe marriage, loves to laugh, explore the world, cook, do outside activities. Is romantic, loves to cuddle, has time for a relationship. Enjoys pampering his lady. Monogamous. Please have nice white teeth, and clean hygiene. Non smoker social rare drinker.


I do attend church, would love to find a fellow christian, who attends, now. A man who loves God and would be willing to attend church on his own and sometimes together. I'm asking that you either are involved in church currently or will be, this is what I seek out. 

Honestly, loyalty, and respect are important in a Ltr.

Responding to my post:

Kindly send new responses. Please put effort into a response. 

(Will not respond to one liners, or just asking one question. I'm not looking to play games. No shirtless photos. Don't have time for negativity.)

Thank you for reading.

Best of luck,

Thank you.

title: Seeking a new best friend / partner / companion / lover
text:
. . .just one man who is age-appropriate (60-75), close in geography (I live mid-peninsula), and similarly inclined (read on).

Neither of us is currently partnered, and we crave the steadfast companionship and deep intimacy we have experienced and expressed in past monogamous relationships. Living long has made us far wiser than we were in our youth. We acknowledge our imperfections and recognize that understanding, compassion, affection, and acceptance are essential to a lasting relationship.

We are both intelligent, articulate people, active and involved, socially and politically liberal, and financially stable. We're still healthy, energetic, and attractive, and we intend to keep ourselves that way for many years to come.

Here are some specifics about me:

I am HWP (5'4" tall, ~137 lbs.) and Caucasian. Raised east-coast Jewish, for the past two decades I have been an active member of a progressive religious community that includes people of all persuasions. I am omnivorous, and get along best with those similarly inclined. Semi-retired now, I continue to seek ways to contribute my experience and energy to people and projects that make a difference in the world. Among the pastimes I enjoy are music and dancing, puzzles, cooking and savoring good food and beverage, hiking and exploring (especially with my canine companion), flowers and plants, computers and the Internet, movies and some TV, home maintenance and renovation. My social and political leanings are decidedly liberal/progressive.

If you resonate with this post, I hope you'll write to tell me about yourself (age and location are essential!), what you're looking for, why you're responding. When you do, please attach a current photo; I will happily reciprocate if we seem to be a match.

title: S&R
text:
S&R you would think it's a simple acronym with a simple meaning. Not so fast...
It could mean...
Safety & Reliability yes, I'll accept that one 
Shipping & Receiving well, that's open to lots of speculation so I'll pass for now
Segmentation & Reassembly I've felt like that sometimes, you probably have too so I'll take it
Seclusion & Restraint (psychiatry, agitated/violent patients) whoa! back up... never me, never you. Period.
Squeaks & Rattles bones & joints sometimes, discuss in your reply for variations on this 
Storage & Retrieval selective memory, that's a given in m/f relations so yep
Suspension & Revocation another never me, never you. 
Sense & Respond Great business strategy, accept
Sales & Return that covers just about all of us lol

Was just trying to be cute by S&R for Search & Rescue. We search each other out and rescue one another from this life of loneliness. City life can feel so isolating at times and I'm just looking for the one. SWF, mid 30s, average

title: Great Catch Seeks Same for LTR
text:
Hi There!

When I've posted before I've described myself first and what I'm looking for second. I'm reversing the order this time in the hope that I'll get fewer replies that are way outside what I'm looking for. For example, more than 10 years younger (or older) than I am isn't what I mean by "reasonably close to my age". So here goes.

WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR:
Please live in San Francisco (or at least close to a nearby BART station), be taller than I am, and reasonably close to my age.

I'm looking for a long-term - hopefully life-long relationship with someone who wants a companion for hiking/biking/walks, intellectual pursuits, cooking/eating, humor, and emotional/physical intimacy - a close friend and lover.

ABOUT ME:
I am warm, intelligent, passionate, and in good shape. I exercise daily (usually by bicycling up to Twin Peaks). I have green eyes and dark brown, wavy hair. I'm 5'8".

Some of the things I enjoy include hiking and bicycling or just wandering around San Francisco. I love animals and nature, and had 2 cats until recently. I like all kinds of restaurants, independent and foreign movies, cooking and sharing a delectable meal at home. I'm an avid reader, listen to NPR a lot, and am a subscriber to City Arts & Lectures. I'm fairly well-traveled (lived in Europe for 8-1/2 years) and would like to do more - especially in Africa and Central & South America.

If the above resonates with you, please tell me a little about yourself and send me a photo. Let's meet for a drink of some kind and get to know each other.

title: I insist on using SKYPE as it lets people discover a lot instantly
text:
Someone has shared this short instruction for single seniors, and I'm posting it in here with my comments.
Yes, I'm a Single 63 y.o. good-looking woman, young in heart and body, and I am attempting to resonate with the heart of a Super Serious Educated Gentleman, Who wants to be in a Committed Relationship. 
Ready to read the text?

"Lots of single seniors stumble through online dating instead of dating smart."
I'm wondering what is "smart dating". . . Of course, dating a coworker whom one knows for a long time would be the best. I my case it's not possible as I'm a privately working teacher.

"Integrity, emotional intelligence, kindness, and compassion, are a few examples of qualities that might make your list, but there are many others."
Certainly, there are the others, but those listed above are most important. 

"Physical appearance, wealth, social status, and other surface qualities are not substitutes for the meaningful, inner qualities on your list."
Physical appearance is strongly connected to the inner beauty, and women are no less visual than men, but no one looks for the correctness of features. Everybody Reads a Lot in the Eyes. Mine are big hazel, looking straight and smiling. You can easily read my thought in them. Unlike many ladies who look like cats, I tell what I think and do what I tell. I risk to open up and face the pain of misunderstanding, but I'll never try to hide anything or Use Anybody.
"Love at first sight is a senior, newbie dating fantasy guaranteed to fail whether you're the one doing the sweeping or being swept. Seniors are too experienced to still believe in love at first sight, which only happens in the movies."
Right, but what about just FEELING who another person is at the 1st sight? Eye expression, language (vocabulary, choice of expressions), the sound of a voice do help a lot to know instantly about what can be expected from a person.

"When a senior dater falls in love based on physical attraction that's actually lust at first sight, and suggests desperation".
Right, desperation or just stupidity.

"Dinner at a romantic restaurant is not a smart first date choice because it doesn't serve either person's purposes."

Of course, even in the times when everything moves fast, going to the restaurant, usually followed by sharing a bed ( am I wrong?) can only witness the total absence of the Seriousness. It's ONLY for one-night stands.
"If you really want to get to know someone on a first date, which is the purpose of a first date anyway, chat with them over coffee for an hour. You're far more likely to ask the tough questions if you're not floating in a romantic bubble, and a second date will be easier to determine after you asked the important questions. "

"Sex on a first or second date isn't a realistic path to fall in love. In fact it will have the exact opposite effect. Sex too soon brings the getting to know you aspect of a relationship to a screeching halt because sex becomes the relationship's focus rather than discovering each other on a deeper level first. And the relationship typically ends a few months later when a couple begins to see each other more clearly."

So, we are talking about the online meetings? Of course, any Normal Person Before Meeting someone should learn much. . . Pretty often the process of learning is hard, and people part before an initial meeting. There are so many paths that lead to misunderstanding, that it takes a good effort to appreciate and see the real person behind the words. 

I insist on using SKYPE as it lets people discover a lot instantly.

It's the very beginning though!

title: Non-American, Intelligent, Complex, Loving
text:
LONG INTRODUCTION

I am a Very Slavic (Ukrainian/ Belarusian) Woman. To be a Slavic woman of my generation means to be Caring, Supportive and Responsible, Well-Educated, Sensitive, Straightforward, Pretty Old-Fashioned, with a strong sense of how a decent woman should act in this "unleashed" world of online dating. 

I'm still 62 ( will turn 63 soon), 5.6, average built, dark-haired, hazel-eyed, nice looking.

And, Yes, I Can Support Myself. 

As any woman, I don't like politics and even consider it to be a dirty business, but nowadays politics is everywhere, and, I think, we can't afford our attempts to stay away. I've been helping victims of the war in Ukraine, protesters against KGB in Russia. My nonprofit school, which can operate as charity, tries to help people connect and help each other. 

I am a proud mother of two beautiful, well-educated daughters, who are in their 30s, married and on their own.

I have lived in US since 2002 and am its citizen. Educator (teacher of music and languages), small school owner, very passionate about my work and children (not only my own). Those little ones refresh my heart and brain and help me stay connected to that little Ukrainian girl in me.

Do you know that "it's tiring for children to explain everything to adults," and that only the adult who is capable of saving a child in his soul is worthy? 

MUSIC: As a classically trained piano teacher, I do love the music I teach. That doesn't mean that my partner has to be in love with it. If you are frustrated that you don't like opera, I can tell you that I do not like Giants and golf:-) and will Never go to watch them with you.

I'm NOT a PARTY PERSON at all. I feel extremely bored there. 

I do love Literature, including poetry, and I teach Russian language and literature ( have a degree) 

HOW I AM DRESSED: yes, most of the time I'm dressed-up like any Slavic woman at work. But I do like to hike, to bike, and to camp.

Although I'm Open, Honest and Strong, I'm OPPOSITE to feminists. There is a good room for a man, whom I'm looking for, by my side.

I would say I am TRANSPARENT. Are you too?

And so on and on... I do have a lot to say, and I hope you too!

title: One-Winged People Fly in Circles
text:
Did you say you are Educated, Manly and Kind Divorced or Widowed Man?
Read on then...
Do you agree that Love is NOT an emotion but rather a decision? I do! Some artist has elaborated on this subject by saying that "Love is very emotional as well as a decision. It is from the heart which can even be more intense when coupled with the brain. True chemistry goes beyond sober thinking and rational decisions".

I TOTALLY agree with him. Still, my statement is valid to keep away those 98% of "grasshoppers".

And I've decided to "steal" another quote and share with you: 

"There's a difference between romance and intimacy. Romance is about personality, and intimacy is about character. Romance is about the lure of surface chemistry, charm -- your socialized self-playing with somebody else's socialized self. It's superficial stuff and not necessarily long-lasting. Intimacy is about connecting soul-to-soul, character-to-character -- sharing your real self with someone else's real self -- and that's what's necessary for a solid, long-lasting relationship".

Well said, right? So, I'm looking for a man who understands that statement and agrees with it. 

I want to connect at all levels and am looking for the man who wants the same--unconditional trust and acceptance to build the true intimacy on.

You've already understood that I am Not looking for "stress reduction", "comfort", banal "fun", financial support and so on. I am looking for My Second Wing to Fly (Yes, at This Age!). One- winged people can only fly in circles, which makes them dizzy and unrealistic (would you agree?) 

I am always Very Happy to meet well-educated people as I'm educated, but I do NOT value diplomas for themselves. I Deeply Appreciate Smart, Creative, Brave people with a Heart, including those who have educated themselves on their own, through their life experiences.

I have never met many men coming from dating sites as it's easy to define who Is Not Him just by reading between their lines. 

I have a very little hope to find My Man here... But we all know that important things happen exactly when there is no hope, or, in different words, the night is darker just before the dawn.

"Women should be protected from anyone's exercise of unrighteous power. . .but then, so should every other living creature."

~ George Eliot When love is born in our hearts, we want only the best for others, for we directly see them as ourselves. The imprisoning illusion of a fundamentally separate self, struggling against other selves for its own rewards, is transcended, and our life becomes dedicated to bringing peace, joy, and fulfillment to others. This brings us our greatest joy, and is the flowering of the highest form of love, which is compassion. title: Women Bring the Devotion and Beauty into Men's Lives
text:
What do women bring to Life aside of the Life they give to the babies? Yes, Devotion and Beauty. They are your Source of Inspiration, They are less tested by increasing hormone level; that's why usually they are better committed partners than men.
Right?
And you know that the level of civilization should be measured by its attitude to a Woman too? 
Good for you!
Then let's talk a little.

I've just turned 63 (Pisces) . Although not a Grandma yet, and I'm a nice looking youthful in mind and body woman, I know that the biggest part of my journey has been already lived. I need to make its final part full of Dignity and Beauty. 
I'm NOT an American "gal" (not Asian or Hispanic nor Hispanic). Guess where attractive women are educated, serious and kind... They are also responsible for their country. Yes, I'm a citizen of yours now...
I'm tired of being a plane with one wing but ready to stay alone till death if my Dignified Knight doesn't appear before. 

I've got education ( multiple degrees), built my career, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes which I would like to avoid repeating.

It seems to me that what an Intelligent, Decent and Honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is how this man relates to her in terms of :

1)her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);
2) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" isn't my match for sure.
3) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Men they Can Respect.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire and to have a chance to TRUST every step my partner makes. I'm a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

Yes, your Celebrating the Existence of Women is Welcome:-)

title: There are so many paths that lead to misunderstanding
text:
Someone has shared this short instruction for single seniors, and I'm posting it in here with my comments.
Yes, I'm a Single 63 y.o. good-looking woman, young in heart and body, and I am attempting to resonate with the heart of a the Wholesome Gentleman, Who wants to be in a Committed Relationship. 
Ready to read the text?

"Lots of single seniors stumble through online dating instead of dating smart."
I'm wondering what is "smart dating". . .

Of course, dating a coworker whom one knows for a long time would be the best. I my case it's not possible as I'm a privately working teacher.

"Integrity, emotional intelligence, kindness, and compassion, are a few examples of qualities that might make your list, but there are many others."

Certainly, there are the others, but those listed above are most important. 

"Physical appearance, wealth, social status, and other surface qualities are not substitutes for the meaningful, inner qualities on your list."

Physical appearance is strongly connected to the inner insight, and women are no less visual than men, but no one looks for the correctness of features. Everybody Reads a Lot in the Eyes. Mine are big hazel, looking straight and smiling. You can easily read my thoughts in them. Unlike many ladies, I tell what I think and do what I tell. I risk to open up and face the pain of misunderstanding, but I'll never try to hide anything or Use Anybody.

"Love at first sight is a senior, newbie dating fantasy guaranteed to fail whether you're the one doing the sweeping or being swept. Seniors are too experienced to still believe in love at first sight, which only happens in the movies."

Right, but what about just FEELING who another person is at the 1st sight? Eye expression, language (vocabulary, choice of expressions), the sound of a voice Do Help a lot to know instantly about what can be expected from a person.

"When a senior dater falls in love based on physical attraction that's actually lust at first sight, and suggests desperation".
Right, desperation or just stupidity.

"Dinner at a romantic restaurant is not a smart first date choice because it doesn't serve either person's purposes."

Of course, even in the times when everything moves fast, going to the restaurant, usually followed by sharing a bed (am I wrong?) can only witness the total absence of the Seriousness on Intents. It's ONLY for one-night stands.

"If you really want to get to know someone on a first date, which is the purpose of a first date anyway, chat with them over coffee for an hour. You're far more likely to ask the tough questions if you're not floating in a romantic bubble, and a second date will be easier to determine after you asked the important questions. "

I ma sure it doesn't matter WHERE to ask tough questions.

"Sex on a first or second date isn't a realistic path to fall in love. In fact it will have the exact opposite effect. Sex too soon brings the getting to know you aspect of a relationship to a screeching halt because sex becomes the relationship's focus rather than discovering each other on a deeper level first. And the relationship typically ends a few months later when a couple begins to see each other more clearly."

So, we are talking about online meetings? Of course, any Normal Person Before Meeting someone should learn much. . . Pretty often the process of learning is hard, frustrating, and people part before an initial meeting. There are so many paths that lead to misunderstanding, that it takes a good effort to appreciate and see the real person behind the words. 

I insist on using SKYPE as it lets people discover a lot instantly.

It's the very beginning though!

title: That Ineffable Quality
text:
I've been around a few blocks in this online dating world, even a few neighborhoods. I've had my share of dates at cafes, restaurants and on hiking trails. I've felt the anticipation and excitement of taking it offline after engaging exchanges that made it seem like we were simply made for one another. I've felt confused when there's been an obviously mutual online connection with someone who then suddenly disappeared. And I've had the experience, more than once, that what appears to click so well online and on the phone doesn't survive the transition into "real life." Have you had any of these experiences?

It's quite a process! Yet here I am, determined to stay open, optimistic and available, and most importantly, to welcome a loving relationship into my life.

With these reflections in mind, I've decided on a change of course. Rather than post a laundry list of who I am and who you're 'supposed' to be, I'm ready for something different. Common interests and values are fundamental -- no doubt about it -- but no matter what's on any of those lists; if that ineffable quality of chemistry isn't present, none of the rest matters. 

What makes that chemistry thing show up is utterly mysterious to me. Physical attraction is only part of it -- it's more of an energetic thing, of this I'm sure. Ohhh, I love the seductive sparks of an instant connection just like anyone, but I'm looking for what endures after the sparks are replaced with something deeper. 

Resonance happens, I think, not with a mouse click, but with the click that comes with presence, with being real and with taking a risk to open to another. Emotional intelligence and plenty of laughter help a lot, too!

If you're interested in and open to an easy meeting with no pressure, and you know how to listen as well as talk and can converse with curiosity, then I'd love to hear from you! Even if those sparks are not ignited between us, we can take a walk or share a beverage or a meal, enjoy one other's company and wish one another well without taking it all too terribly personally. 

I'm ready ... are you?

title: Lively, alluring, youthful woman seeks chivalrous man
text:
I've been told that I have a presence. Men take notice when I'm in the room. I am the woman laughing and bringing a smile to everyone around her. People immediately feel at ease with me. I love music, dancing, and the rich aroma of a well-aged tawny port. Feeling the warmth of the sunrays caressing my bare skin brings me pleasure.

I feel cherished when a man:
- opens the door for me
- plans the date
- calls me after a date to see if I made it home safely
- texts me just to say he's thinking of me
- brings me flowers for no reason
- holds my hand

If you can see yourself in the scenario below, I'd love to hear from you. You're the man I'm looking for! Tell me a bit about yourself and why this scenario resonates with you. Note that my man is within five years of my age. Photos are appreciated.

On my birthday, he takes me to dinner at Chez Panisse because he knows that I've never been there for dinner and always wanted to go there. It's a warm summer night and I am wearing my red dress. He is looking handsome as usual in a suit. I have a huge grin on my face as I excitedly look at the menu.

We are sitting at an intimate table in the corner of the restaurant enjoying a glass of tawny port after a delicious meal. The port is golden brown and I can smell the rich aromas waffling from a distance. The restaurant is bustling with happy people. The scents from all of the heavenly dishes around us are mingling in the air.

He has told the waiter that we are celebrating my birthday and has pre-arranged to have the staff bring creme br√ªl√©e with a lit candle, singing "Happy Birthday" to me. He knows that I love creme br√ªl√©e. Everyone in the restaurant joins in and sings with the staff. There is loud clapping afterwards. I haven't felt so adored since my 10th birthday party! He's taking selfies of us and I'm smiling from ear to ear.

After finishing the sweet-smelling vanilla dessert, he presents me with my birthday gift. He has a mischievous grin on his face as I open the carefully wrapped present. The wrapping is purple because he knows that's my favorite color. When I open the box, I find an iPod because he knows that I don't have an iPod for my car. I look at him wide-eyed and thank him for the thoughtful gift with a tender kiss.

He suggests that we listen to the iPod on the way home and that's when I find out that it has all of my favorite songs on it. He knows what songs to add because he knows about my list of favorite songs that I keep on my computer. He is smiling slyly feeling clever than ever. When I realize that the iPod has all of my favorite songs on it, I realize at that moment that the man sitting next to me is my soulmate. This man knows me and aims to please me. I am feeling happier and more content than I have ever felt in my life.

NIGHT SONG

You speak, and my heart slips between my legs and starts to beat.
"Uh-huh," you say, "uh-huh,"
and your voice is in my blood, moving with the music of the night,
drawing me back into myself,
swaying with the rhythms of a dream, forgotten and foresworn,

and I, full of gratitude and longing,
wash over you

title: To Trust Every Step my Partner Makes
text:
What do women bring to Life aside of the Life they give to the babies? Yes, Devotion and Beauty. They are your Source of Inspiration, They are less tested by increasing hormone level; that's why usually they are better committed partners than men.
Right?
And you know that the level of civilization should be measured by its attitude to a Woman too? 
Good for you!
Then let's talk a little.

I've just turned 63 (Pisces) . Although not a Grandma yet, and I'm a nice looking youthful in mind and body woman, I know that the biggest part of my journey has been already lived. I need to make its final part full of Dignity and Beauty. 
I'm NOT an American "gal" (not Asian or Hispanic nor Hispanic). Guess where attractive women are educated, serious and kind... They are also responsible for their country. Yes, I'm a citizen of yours now...
I'm tired of being a plane with one wing but ready to stay alone till death if my Dignified Knight doesn't appear before. 

I've got education ( multiple degrees), built my career, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes which I would like to avoid repeating.

It seems to me that what an Intelligent, Decent and Honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is how this man relates to her in terms of :

1)her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);
2) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" isn't my match for sure.
3) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Men they Can Respect.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire and to have a chance to TRUST every step my partner makes. I'm a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

Yes, your Celebrating the Existence of Women is Welcome:-)

title: Slippery road
text:
Someone has shared this short instruction for single seniors, and I'm posting it in here with my comments and my own ideas.
Yes, I'm a Single 63 y.o. good-looking woman, young in heart and body, and I am attempting to resonate with the heart of a the Wholesome Gentleman, Who wants to be in a Committed Relationship.
Ready to read the text?

"Lots of single seniors stumble through online dating instead of dating smart."

I'm wondering what is "smart dating". . .

Of course, dating a coworker whom one knows for a long time would be the best. I my case it's not possible as I'm a privately working teacher.

"Integrity, emotional intelligence, kindness, and compassion, are a few examples of qualities that might make your list, but there are many others."

Certainly, there are the others, but those listed above are most important. 

"Physical appearance, wealth, social status, and other surface qualities are not substitutes for the meaningful, inner qualities on your list."

Physical appearance is strongly connected to the inner beauty or ugliness, and women are no less visual than men, but no one looks for the correctness of features. Everybody Reads a Lot in the Eyes. Mine are big hazel, looking straight and smiling. You can easily read my thoughts in them. Unlike many ladies, I tell what I think and do what I tell. I risk to open up and face the pain of misunderstanding, but I'll never try to hide anything or Use Anybody.

"Love at first sight is a senior, newbie dating fantasy guaranteed to fail whether you're the one doing the sweeping or being swept. Seniors are too experienced to still believe in love at first sight, which only happens in the movies."

Right, but what about just FEELING who another person is at the 1st sight? Eye expression, language (vocabulary, choice of expressions), the sound of a voice Do Help a lot to know instantly about what can be expected from a person. But then, definitely, it's safer to check if the impressions one got online resonate with those from initial meeting impressions. It is a must to TEST a stranger before opening up. Otherwise, the pain and disappointment are unavoidable. 

"When a senior dater falls in love based on physical attraction that's actually lust at first sight, and suggests desperation".

Right, desperation or lack of seriousness. Or those unsophisticated seniors consciously limit their expectations to the psychical area. They just don't look for a relationship. 

"Dinner at a romantic restaurant is not a smart first date choice because it doesn't serve either person's purposes."

Of course, even in the times of High Tech, when everything in life moves so fast, a trip to the restaurant, usually followed by sharing a bed (am I wrong?), can only witness the total absence of the Seriousness of Intents and lack of expectations. It's ONLY for one-night stands.




"If you really want to get to know someone on a first date, which is the purpose of a first date anyway, chat with them over coffee for an hour. You're far more likely to ask the tough questions if you're not floating in a romantic bubble, and a second date will be easier to determine after you asked the important questions. "





I am sure it doesn't matter WHERE to ask tough questions. But it's much better to invite a person to join a hiking group and see how that person acts being among people. 

"Sex on a first or second date isn't a realistic path to fall in love. In fact it will have the exact opposite effect. title: Women Bring the Beauty and Devotion to the Men's Lives
text:
What do women bring to Life aside of the Life they give to the babies? 

Yes, Devotion and Beauty. They are your Source of Inspiration, They are less tested by increasing hormone level; that's why usually they are better committed partners than men.
Right?
And you know that the level of civilization should be measured by its attitude to a Woman too? 
Good for you!
Then let's talk a little.

I've just turned 63 (Pisces) . Although not a Grandma yet but nice looking, youthful in mind and body woman, I know that the biggest part of my journey has been already lived up. I need to make its final part full of Dignity and Beauty. 
I'm NOT an American "gal" (not Asian nor Hispanic). Guess where attractive women are educated, serious and kind... They are also responsible for their country. But I'm a US citizen...

I'm tired of being a plane with one wing but ready to stay alone till death if my Dignified Man doesn't appear before. 

I've got education ( multiple degrees), built my career, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes, which I would like to avoid repeating.

It seems to me that what an Intelligent, Decent and Honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is how this man relates to her in terms of :

1) her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), 2) her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), 3) the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my teaching profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);
4) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" isn't my match for sure.
5) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Men they Can Respect and Love.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire and to have a chance to TRUST every step my partner makes. As a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

Yes, your Celebrating the Existence of Women is Welcome:-)

"Lots of single seniors stumble through online dating instead of dating smart."

I'm wondering what is "smart dating". . .

Of course, dating a coworker whom one knows for a long time would be the best. I my case it's not possible as I'm a privately working teacher.

"Integrity, emotional intelligence, kindness, and compassion, are a few examples of qualities that might make your list, but there are many others."

Certainly, there are the others, but those listed above are most important. 

"Physical appearance, wealth, social status, and other surface qualities are not substitutes for the meaningful, inner qualities on your list."

Physical appearance is strongly connected to the inner beauty or ugliness, and women are no less visual than men, but no one looks for the correctness of features. Everybody Reads a Lot in the Eyes. Mine are big hazel, looking straight and smiling. You can easily read my thoughts in them. Unlike many ladies, I tell what I think and do what I tell. I risk to open up and face the pain of misunderstanding, but I'll never try to hide anything or Use Anybody.

"Love at first sight is a senior, newbie dating fantasy guaranteed to fail whether you're the one doing the sweeping or being swept. Seniors are too experienced to still believe in love at first sight, which only happens in the movies."

Right, but what about just FEELING who another person is at the 1st sight? Eye expression, language (vocabulary, choice of expressions), the sound of a voice Do Help a lot to know instantly about what can be expected from a person. But then, definitely, it's safer to check if the impressions one got online resonate with those from initial meeting impressions. It is a must to TEST a stranger before opening up. "When a senior dater falls in love based on physical attraction that's actually lust at first sight, and suggests desperation".

Right, desperation or lack of seriousness. Or those unsophisticated seniors consciously limit their expectations to the psychical area. They just don't look for a relationship. 

"Dinner at a romantic restaurant is not a smart first date choice because it doesn't serve either person's purposes."

Of course, even in the times of High Tech, when everything in life moves so fast, a trip to the restaurant, usually followed by sharing a bed (am I wrong?), can only witness the total absence of the Seriousness of Intents and lack of expectations. It's ONLY for one-night stands.

"If you really want to get to know someone on a first date, which is the purpose of a first date anyway, chat with them over coffee for an hour. You're far more likely to ask the tough questions if you're not floating in a romantic bubble, and a second date will be easier to determine after you asked the important questions. "

I am sure it doesn't matter WHERE to ask tough questions. But it's much better to invite a person to join a hiking group and see how that person acts being among people.

text:
I am seeking a man who ultimately desires and is capable of lifelong companionship (and in the long-run, marriage), but who can be content starting off slowly. I'm looking for my true mate. Not interested in casual dating with multiple people. I know that it takes some time to really know if we are in love, much less compatible for the long haul.. but if you are not wanting ltr as your main goal in dating, I'm probably not the one for you. My ideal partner will be someone who loves time together and apart, who is educated, curious about life, playful, enjoys the magic in small moments, patient with my busy schedule as I'm finishing up a degree and being a mom, who can appreciate my liberal social-justice oriented values if not share them, but non-radical and non-dogmatic please! 

Since being in school and being a mom, I have spent a lot of time at home. But I love to travel, take walks, dance (though I'm not great at it) and look forward to those things when I get more time. Spiritual awareness as a priority is important to me. I'm looking for someone who is living a life of meaning and purpose, and who is financially secure. A health field would be a good match. Of utmost priority is peaceful respectful relations in relationship. If you are prone to get in arguments, have a history of anger or resentment, blame your exes for your past relationship problems, are critical, etc, we aren't a good match. My reason for being in intimate relationship is to love and accept, and enjoy the warmth and security of your love and acceptance. Other relationships in life are for other kinds of relating.. intimate relationships are for gentleness, exploration, caring, love, collaboration, and acceptance. Everyone needs a resting place, a sanctuary to come home to. May we find that in our relationship. 

If you love animals, kids, and eventually want to live somewhere beautiful, warm, with lots of nature all around, that'd be wonderful. A note: I want you for your heart and soul, and I will love your body because it is yours and I respect and love you. That's what I'd like to find in a mate. My body size and shape currently reflects my years as a very busy mom and student, as I work all day and rarely leave the house at night due to my child being with me. I look forward to when I have time to get back into good self-care and healing in that regard. But if you are looking for an un-fluffy tummy and lithe thighs etc, that's not me at this point. And, I don't want to be with someone who wants a woman for his arm.. I want to be with someone who wants a woman for his spirit. I'm not obese, but I've got some extra pounds at the moment (though I am eager to get out and reclaim my active lifestyle.) title: The Final Chapter Should Be Beautiful!
text:
What do women bring to Life aside of the Life they give to the babies? Yes, Devotion and Beauty. They are your Source of Inspiration, They are less tested by increasing hormone level than men; that's why usually they are better committed partners.
Right?

And you know that the level of civilization should be measured by its attitude to a Woman too? 
Hopefully, you won't think that I'm "too complicated and challenging." 

Then let's talk a little. But I'm complex and intelligent indeed:-)

I'm 63.... Although not a Grandma yet, and a nice looking youthful in mind and body woman, I know that the biggest part of my journey has been already lived up. I need to make its final part full of Dignity and Beauty. 

I'm NOT an American "gal", not Asian or Hispanic. Guess where attractive women are feminine, educated, strong and kind and CARING... They are also responsible for their country. Yes, I'm a citizen of yours now, but Ukraine is in my heart, especially now, when there is a hybrid war...

I'm tired of being a plane with one wing but ready to stay alone till death if my Dignified man doesn't appear before. 

I've got education (multiple degrees), built my career, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes which I would like to avoid repeating.

It seems to me that what an Intelligent, Decent and Honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is how this man relates to her in terms of :

1) her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);

2) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" has nothing to do by my side.

3) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Men they Can Respect.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire and to have a chance to TRUST every step my partner makes. I'm a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

It's also important that a man doesn't try to load a new partner with his baggage. Even a widowed man has to be delicate to the degree where a woman feels his PRESENCE in a moment, not in his past. Those who passed away are beloved forever as people only want to have good memories. Still, a new relationship is extremely fragile, and it can bring too much pain to the woman, who's decided to ... compete with the man's memories...

title: Real Challenge, Real Feelings, Real Life!
text:
Greetings to those who risks to come to this place...

It's an interesting place with a wide range of visitors, who have a huge range of agendas.
To be honest, it's NOT a safe place. Still, it seems to me, if I'm serious enough communicating my ideas and feelings, I can draw the attention of like-minded people of an opposite gender.
I HAVE A QUESTION:
Would you agree that most women are more complicated than most men?
Let me use quotes:
"Men are direct and to the point, and they have no secret meaning behind their words or actions. Women are testers, analyzers and observers.
Biologically, inherently, women are no more "complicated" than men. The differences between the two are a result of the gendered characteristics we as a culture have assigned to the sexes. 
Hence the communication difficulties is a majority of heterosexual relationships. 
If you are born with a woman, you aren't raised to be forward and direct and speak your mind. You say what is right, what people want to hear, because confrontation isn't "ladylike." You sit in the corner and you play with your dolls and you quietly and quaintly observe the happenings around you until the day you die.
Hence the reason women are, generally speaking, fantastic "testers, analyzers, and observers."
If you're born a man, on the other hand, it's nearly the exact opposite. You're raised to be strong and powerful. That's what masculinity is all about. It is your JOB to speak up and speak out, to get things done correctly and quickly. That's how you become a successful provider and therefore a successful male. You play outside with your tool sets and you learn how to build fires and change tires. You get stuff done, and you do it 'til you die.
Hence the reason men are, generally speaking, more "direct and to the point."
And this directness, this inability to take the time to stop and think, to look, to analyze, to just observe and think about OTHERS for once--this keystone of masculine "simplicity" --it proves no less complications."


So, did you like the quotes?

I'm NOT one of those women who have had time to "sit and play with dolls" . . . I've achieved a lot, raised educated children on my own, moved to a foreign country and survived there.

I do Not look for what 99.99% of people on dating sites come there for: "cuddling", "kisses", "beaches"-"FUN FUN FUN." 

No, I look for REAL things, which include commitment, sometimes the pain of misunderstanding, Real Challenge, Real Trust, Real Love.

I'm here and everywhere for Real Life! And I do have a long, long profile to send you.
What about you? What did you come to this site for?

title: I Am for Challenge. And You?
text:
Someone smart said this:

"There's a difference between romance and intimacy. 
Romance is about personality, and intimacy is about character. 

Romance is about the lure of surface chemistry, charm -- your socialized self-playing with somebody else's socialized self. It's superficial stuff and not necessarily long-lasting. Intimacy is about connecting soul-to-soul, character-to-character -- sharing your real self with someone else's real self -- and that's what's necessary for a solid, long-lasting relationship".

Well said, right? So, I'm looking for a man who understands that statement and agrees with it. 

I'm NOT looking for the cheapness of "hooking up", "healthy sex","stress reduction", "comfort", banal "fun", which for a great majority of people is associated with ROMANCE. 

INTIMACY is Much More Complex to Develop. And I look for a BRAVE individual who believes that it is possible, and this is what he wants.

I Am a Normal Strong and Loving Woman, who has rained the children and has been building her life without a man for many years, and who believes that it's time to eventually find her match. 

Skype helps! Yes, I do want to CHALLENGE you, a gentleman in your 60s, who has never used skype. This is the 1st test you need to pass having your open face before the camera. 

I can read well between the lines. The level of INTELLECT is something I can immediately notice, and it attracts me.

title: Although I'm Open, Honest and Strong, I'm OPPOSITE to feminists
text:
I am a Very Slavic (Ukrainian/ Belarusian) Woman. To be a Slavic woman of my generation means to be Caring, Supportive and Responsible, Well-Educated, Sensitive, Straightforward, Pretty Old-Fashioned, with a strong sense of how a decent woman should act in this "unleashed" world of online dating. 

I'm 63, Pisces, 5.6, average built, dark-haired, hazel-eyed, nice looking.

And, Yes, I Can Support Myself. 

As any woman, I don't like politics and even consider it to be a dirty business, but nowadays politics is everywhere, and, I think, we can't afford our attempts to stay away. I've been helping victims of the war in Ukraine, protesters against KGB in Russia. My nonprofit school, which can operate as charity, tries to help people connect and help each other. 

I am a proud mother of two beautiful, well-educated daughters, who are in their 30s, married and on their own.

I have lived in US since 2002 and am its citizen. Educator (teacher of music and languages), small school owner, very passionate about my work and children (not only my own). Those little ones refresh my heart and brain and help me stay connected to that little Ukrainian girl in me.

Do you know that "it's tiring for children to explain everything to adults," and that only the adult who is capable of saving a child in his soul is worthy? 

HOW I AM DRESSED: yes, most of the time I'm dressed-up like any Slavic woman at work. But I do like to hike, to bike, and to camp,.

MUSIC: As a classically trained piano teacher, I do love the music I teach. That doesn't mean that my partner has to be in love with it. If you are frustrated that you don't like opera, I can tell you that I do not like Giants and golf:-) and will Never go with you to watch them.

I'm NOT a PARTY PERSON at all. I feel extremely bored there. 

I do love Literature, including poetry, and I teach Russian language and literature ( have a degree) 

Although I'm Open, Honest and Strong, I'm OPPOSITE to feminists. There is a good room for a man, whom I'm looking for, by my side.

I would say I am TRANSPARENT. Are you too?

And so on and on... I do have a lot to say, and I hope you too!

title: peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic
text:
What do women bring to Life aside of the Life they give to the babies? 

Yes, Devotion and Beauty. They are your Source of Inspiration, They are less tested by increasing hormone level; that's why usually they are better committed partners than men.
Right?
And you know that the level of civilization should be measured by its attitude to a Woman too? 
Good for you!
Then let's talk a little.

I've just turned 63 (Pisces) . Although not a Grandma yet but nice looking, youthful in mind and body woman, I know that the biggest part of my journey has been already lived up. I need to make its final part full of Dignity and Beauty. 
I'm NOT an American "gal" (not Asian nor Hispanic). Guess where attractive women are educated, serious and kind... They are also responsible for their country. 

But I'm a US citizen now...

I'm tired of being a plane with one wing but ready to stay alone till death if my Dignified Man doesn't appear before. 

I've got education ( multiple degrees), built my career, raised the children and made a certain number of mistakes, which I would like to avoid repeating.

It seems to me that what an Intelligent, Decent and Honest woman, looking for a partner for a final chapter of her life, needs to think of is how this man relates to her in terms of :

1) her views and beliefs ( I have a high spirit, believe in education, am opposite to feminists but can't be told what to do by anybody. I greet the wind in the face!), 2) her attitude to politics (I'm active and passionate about what I believe in. In short, I'm an activist), 3) the work she does ( I'm going to never retire as I love my teaching profession and can always work part time, while having an opportunity to choose when and how much to work, and this is my way of expressing myself in life);
4) how compatible their characters are. (I'm peaceful, friendly, dignified, not materialistic and not diplomatic-just desperately sincere and unable to stand insincere, indecisive and fearful beings.) I can't be "controlled" by the man as I'm absolutely committed by nature. I will ask for advice myself but won't stand constant "corrections". To put it in a nutshell, I'm Not a Follower and Not a Leader. I can only walk by the side of my equal. An "alpha male" isn't my match for sure.
5) if they are compatible sexually. By this age, too many men have lost their potency while women, after having given all they should to the children and families, are still up to experiencing the richness of love life with the Men they Can Respect and Love.

Right, it's Very Hard to Meet Such Men on Dating Sites. 

We love with our soul and body, don't we? I'm passionate and intense if in love (You know that Love Is Demanding, right?), and I want to be on fire and to have a chance to TRUST every step my partner makes. As a devoted and reliable friend, and I need to feel the reciprocation of the same level; otherwise, my feminine pride will push me to leaving. 

Yes, your Celebrating the Existence of Women is Welcome:-)

title: birthday wish
text:
I've been out of dating market for a couple of years, caught up with family matters, definitely my dating skills got rusted but the spirit of upcoming BD sends this vibration and I got the idea to open a profile in Match. . .and it was a very strange experience. . .it looked like that site is a community of picture/profile collectors and military men who has a very similar life story and are desperately seeking for the place to settle down. I closed my profile after second week. I have been lucky with CL in the past, so I try it again. I've read men's ads but never responded, so I really appreciate your courage to click the button Reply.
About me: a midage woman, not drop dead gorgeous any more but traces of that youth glory are still present and noticeable, well dressed and very well educated, I've never been overweight, do not follow any special diet, just healthy living and moderate exercise, Slavic blood, lived in different countries, so I carry mixed cultural habits, speak languages from different language groups, do not follow any traditions, religions but very curios to explore new cultures, rites, laws. . .SF is a good place for that, I live here for more than a decade and seems I've got everything to be the happiest one in this city and definitely I will be when meet you.. You are my BD wish and I take it seriously, do not fall from your chair laughing too loud, the process is usually more interesting than the aim itself ...I am not a romantic fool but used to hear that I wear my heart on a sleeve, I want to be more secretive but probably it's too late to get this trait so I'm vulnerable and open and doesn't matter that I look like very confident and tough. . .it's just a look. I will be very mellow with an open, giving, nurturing man and I can be very sarcastic and rude with a jerk. I'm friendly and have been told from left and right that I make people feel comfortable and relaxed, probably too friendly since my grown kids still live with me and I think it is time to make them feel less comfortable focusing on my personal life and I expect your help in this endeavor. 
How I visualize you: positive, authentic, mentally-emotionally-physically-financially balanced, expressive in what is important to him and what he wants next in his life, open-minded, curious, interested in learning new things, new people, other cultures, who is capable of loving relationships, someone who is more than himself. . .Physical attractiveness is important, for me it is an indicator of a good health and the habits to take care of yourself and overall healthy life style, so, please, be somehow attractive and not only for your mom's eyes but listen what your buddies say...I admire 6-pack abs and nicely shaped buttocks but I know already that all it fades with time and if there's nothing inside then there's no cure for it. . .so, please, be educated and at least familiar with the European map and history so you will not get surprised that Slovenia and Slovakia is not the same country. . .I am not a pro with American history and I would be delighted if you tell me about facts I do not know. . .I am not looking for a new husband; and I am definitely not looking for Gigolo, a boy-toy, I'm also not interested in one night stands. I would go for equal relationships: to come together to share our lives, to enjoy the finer things in life. . . You know that feeling, when your heart is pumping when you see the message on your phone or just hear the voice. . . these are the moments we all want to experience again and again! 
Chemistry is the key for that unique sensual connection and mutual physical attraction. As I said I can be friends with anyone but the romance is different. You might like one's photo and writings but you have to meet them, look into their eyes and be yourself with them and be liked by them. We can tell within few minutes of meeting if there is any physical chemistry between us. 
Please, live in SF that we can easily get together for spontaneous outings after work or weekends when that vibe and our time get in sync. . .I personally cannot respect cheaters, so you should be a single, divorced, widower, and not "traveling adventurous", bisex, trans, and other local trends, I am not interested to explore this part deeper, I have already enough info about it from media, parade and a couple of local friends. 

Many thanks for the reading to this point, I'm impressed already if you reach this point!
I've wrote this essay, and you know I am available, totally free from any attachment or drama so if you liked anything in what you have read, simply send me a note. 
Good luck to all and each of us here ;)

title: SWF Enjoys Peeling Onions
text:
We all have many layers to us. If you saw me on the street--don't deny it--you'd size me up. Since you're doing this online I'll help. I'm 5' 8", blonde, and wear glasses. Not a will o' the wisp sort but I've got plenty of muscle and the right kind of curves. It's okay, go ahead and stare. :-)

Next you'd notice my smile and laugh...if you talked to me you'd find out I'm wry, liberal, direct, and well-educated. An outsized, friendly personality.

If you asked me out you'd notice my presence, warmth, and natural curiosity. I'd try to figure out if we're compatible by talking about some of my favorite movies (Ice Storm, Big Lebowski, Fantastic Mr. Fox), music (Bach, Miles, Monk, Richard Thompson, Sharon Jones, and much more) food (lasagna, roasted chicken), or things to do (hiking, running, window shopping). I'd have to talk about my kids (hopefully you're interested), because they are a constant driving force in everything I do. I may or may not talk about my work, which is satisfying and challenging. There would be plenty of questions asked of you...a natural, easy give & take.

If after this date you wanted to keep seeing me, you'd come to know me well and appreciate that I'm a steady, caring woman; incredibly determined with a softer inner core; a great cook; really good at making things happen. That my librarian looks belie something more sensual than you were expecting. Most important of all: that I have a pretty decent bead on life and I'm incredibly happy where I'm at, which makes me a great person to be around. I could keep going but I need to save something for later. 

How about you? What's in your layers? Do you know yourself to the core?

Looking to have steady, monogamous, heartfelt fun on the way to something lasting with someone established/educated/SINGLE, 45-55, East Bay-based. If you choose to write, please change the subject of your reply to your birth month.

Thanks for reading, and best of luck in your search.
